loans.name: Everlide

texts.es:
Everlide de 47 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio y tener un mejor inventario.

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Everlide, 47, has won the hearts of all her neighbors for her kindness and good sense of humor. She loves her family, which is the principle driving force to fight every day and generate sustenance to survive. 

Even though she didn't have resources to start her business, this didn't stop her from achieving her dream of becoming a shopkeeper; with a little capital, this woman started a business selling groceries. 

Her dreams haven't stopped, and so she finds herself asking for a loan, which she will invest in buying a selection of products for family food baskets she can provide in her store and thus have a better inventory.

She hopes to be able to improve her economic conditions, get to old age without monetary worries, and guarantee her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy a selection of products for family food baskets

loans.name: Hector Fernando

texts.es:
Hector inicio la venta de productos Amway, hace meses atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a un amigo, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como hombre pujante y emprendedor busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar. 
Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Hector y se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que vende y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 
Trabaja solo todos los días durante 8 horas.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de productos de uso personal.
Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en el propietario de un almacén con gran variedad de productos y sabe que está por buen camino de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Hector is an energetic and entrepreneurial young man who is eagerly looking for a way to support his household. He began selling Amway products a few months ago, after a friend taught him the sales business. Hector works independently for eight hours each day, going to his customers door to door.  

Hector needs to boost his income to meet the higher cost of living, so he needs a loan to provide financial support so that he can improve the variety of products that he sells and offers his clients each day. Hector plans to use the loan for the purchase of personal care products. 

Hector's main ambition is to become the owner of a store with an excellent variety of products. He knows he's on the right path, with the support of the Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products.

loans.name: Protus's Group

texts.en:
Protus is pictured here. He is the leader of a group of 11 farmers from the Kakamega North District, Kenya. Protus is married and is a father to one child. He is known by his community as a very trustworthy person.

Initially, Protus joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to earn enough money to feed his family. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Protus plans to send his children to school.

The 11 farmers in Protus's Group will plant a total of 7.25 acres of land using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive one solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 45 years old, is married, and has seven children.

Florence likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learnt a lot from farming training sessions. Florence plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Florence’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Benito Jose

texts.es:
Benito es un campesino de 63 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de cafe, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Tierra Alta, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su familia.

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y así mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Benito, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Benito, 63, is a modest, hard-working man.  He learned farming from his parents when he was a boy and has always made his living from the land.  He grows coffee now and sells his beans in the market at Tierra Alta.  He also works as a day laborer on other farms.  The extra income helps to cover the family's expenses.

Benito will use this Corporación Interactuar loan to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizer, pesticides, etc.--to maximize his yields and earn as much from his hard work as possible.  

Benito is a born entrepreneur, driven and tenacious.  He wants to go on fighting for his dream of owning a farm of his own, one where he can grow a range of crops.  A farm of his own would bring in more income and a more stable future for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Berlis Bernuil

texts.es:
Berlis es una madre muy responsable de 4 hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para 
poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Berlis también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Berlis has 4 children, all still living at home.  She has faced many obstacles over the years, but has always found the strength to carry on and keep her family together.  She has an eggs sales business and keeps chickens to maintain it.

Berlis wants to grow her business and knows that she can succeed with the help of Corporación Interactuar and the people who support the bank's mission.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more chickens.  The investment will allow her to meet local demand for eggs and, in turn, increase her income from the business.

Berlis hopes to continue growing her business because it is her means of ensuring that her children have a better and more stable future.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stylish ready-made women’s clothing to resell

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 45 years old, is married and has 5 children.

David likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. David plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, David’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Al- Hobeshi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Hobeshi and consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Melki is a 60-year-old widow woman with three children. After her husband passed away several years ago, Melki assumed all the responsibility of her children. Her oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest one is 18 years old. 

She has a strong determination to provide her children with all things they need. In order to do that, she has started a humble business of selling accessories, makeup, cosmetics, and women's clothes door to door. She started that business more than four years ago. 

The income from this simple business is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the children, and she wants to increase her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of retail items such as cosmetics, makeup and accessories to enlarge her business.

Melki expects a boost in her income and hopes to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more retail items such as cosmetics, makeup and accessories to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Sras's Grdup Group

texts.en:
Sras’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sras makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is married with four children. She lives in a rural area and was born in 1972. For the past ten years, she has been a farmer who works seasonally. Zuhro is a hardworking woman who is a bright, honest, and cheerful person. She lives with her husband’s family; her sister- and brother-in-law are blind and her in-laws are pensioners. Zuhro’s family is poor. She plants cotton but has gained less profit this year because the season was less rainy. Her husband is an educated man who has a good place to work but his salary cannot feed all of their family. Every year, Zuhro’s husband flies to Russia to earn additional income as an emigrant. 

Along with her family, Zuhro is planning to hold a wedding party for her daughter. She is requesting a loan to support the expenses of her daughter’s wedding party.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn Đông -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Dũng is 52 years old and is married with four children. For more than ten years, she has operated a food stall where she sells fish. Dũng lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of the Nhóm 07 thôn Đông -Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of six members. Dũng joined Thanh Hoa Fund For Poor Women in 2007 to improve her business and she has successfully repaid eight previous loans. Her main business hardship is the lack of capital.

Dũng is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. With her business profit, she hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 28 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Melchora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melchora has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melchora aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and has two children.  Evelyn is married and both of her children are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Evelyn has been raising ducks for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Kitomie

texts.en:
Kitomie is 53 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. To help support her family, she has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns income from general store.

Kitomie is requesting a loan of PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is forty one years old and lives in Kasese, Uganda, with her husband and six children. She has a dream of improving her family's standard of living. 

Currently, Anna is a program coordinator at a school but is faced with a low salary and a long distance to the place where she teaches. To earn additional income, Anna also owns a retail shop where she sells general merchandise. A loan of $1225 will help Anna stock her store with sugar, salt, soap, soft drinks and other general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, soft drinks and other general merchandise.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. Alma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items such as pants, shirts, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as pants, shirts, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Bernaly

texts.en:
Bernaly is 21 years old and married with one child. 

Bernaly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Bernaly has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Bernaly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anastasia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Anastasia es una agricultora muy habilidosa con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.
Tiene un cultivo de plátano que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos por los cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlos adelante.

Ella desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como pesticidas, abonos y semillas de plátano, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarle a sus hijos un buen futuro!
texts.en:
Anastasia is a long-time farmer, skilled in various aspects of farming.  She is a born entrepreneur with an innate talent for teamwork.  She grows plantains on her farm and works every day from dawn to dusk.  

Anastasia lives with her husband and two children and says that she wants to provide for them in every way that she can.  She is applying for a loan so that she can grow her business and, in turn, increase her income.  She will use the loan to buy the supplies she needs--pesticides, fertilizer, seeds, etc.--to maximize her yields.

For the future, Anastasia wants a house of her own and a great future for her children!

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Yaned Andrea

texts.es:
Yaned es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 
Desde hace 3 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. Entre sus clientes se encuentran niños (Ver Foto) y personas adultas.
Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas.
Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su única hija. 
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 
Yaned manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yaned is a woman who is dedicated to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perseverance has allowed her to move forward, surpassing various obstacles throughout her life.

Three years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon located in a space in her home. Additionally, she also provides home service, according to the needs of her clients. Her clients include children (see photo) and adults. She works for ten hours every day. This has allowed her to generate sufficient resources to support her husband with household responsibilities and to fulfill the needs of her only daughter. 

Yaned will use this loan to buy a hairdryer and wholesale supplies, such as hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, etc. This will permit her to continue with her work and to provide more complete services to her clients in a more flexible and efficient manner, which will increase the profits she receives for her labor. 

Yaned says that her greatest wish is to be able to continue her work, to recognize and strengthen her business in order to be more competitive in the marketplace, and to have the capacity to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and wholesale supplies (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioners, nail polish, etc).

loans.name: Ciri Elena

texts.es:
Ciri es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 18 años de edad, estudiante universitaria y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 2 años comenzó a vender ropa con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como jeans, camisas, camisetas, entre otros, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 10 horas.
Ciri tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Ciri is a young, dynamic business woman.  She is 18 years old, a college student and a business owner.  Two years ago, she started selling clothing with the goal of generating an income to contribute to her household and pay for her education.

The loan that she is seeking will help strengthen her business as she will use the money to purchase a wholesale assortment of clothing including jeans, shirts, blouses, etc.  This will allow her to provide more variety and better service to her customers, making her business more profitable.

She works alone 10 hours a day, everyday.  Ciri's goal is to get ahead with her business because she wants to become a successful business owner so that she can guarantee her family a better quality of life.  She knows that with the help of Kiva and Corporación Interactuar, she will be able to achieve all of this and more.

loans.use: purchase a wholesale assortment of clothes including jeans, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es:
Elvia es una mujer guerrera, de 47 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos 2 de ellas menores de edad, y los otros dos adolescentes, ella se separó de su esposo y de verdad mantener su familia se le ha hecho muy difícil, gracias a un negocio de salón de belleza que está adecuando desde 2007, ha podido salir adelante pero aún le falta.
Como se puede ver en la foto necesita realizar unas adecuaciones, poner cerámica la suelo, pintar las paredes, tener una silla para motilar y todos estas necesidades son las que la llevan a solicitar un crédito pues está a puertas de un cierre por no cumplir las normas.
texts.en:
Elvia is a fighter.  She is a 47-year-old mother of four, two of which are young and two that are teenagers.  She divorced her husband and it has been difficult to support her family on her own.  Thanks to the beauty salon that she has owned since 2007, she has been able to get ahead but she is still falling short.

As can be seen in the picture, she must make some repairs such as laying tile on the floor, painting the walls, and getting a chair to cut hair in.  All of these necessary repairs are what have led her to seek this loan because her business is on the verge of being shut down if she does not make these improvements.

loans.use: fix up her business, lay tile, and paint the walls so that her business will not be shut down.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy con un gran espíritu trabajador y aventurero, se dedica a la pesca desde hace 14 años con una meta fija que es la de poder salir adelante y poder construir junto a su familia un buen futuro.

Es padre responsable de 4 hijos menores de edad a los cuales siempre ha procurado ofrecerles la mejor educación que le sea posible.

Trabaja todos los días en su negocio durante jornadas de 12 horas en busca de una buena pesca.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un chinchorro y una tarraya para facilitar su pesca y mejorar las condiciones de su trabajo.

Estos elementos le permitirán trabajar más cómodamente y tendrá una mejor producción.

Ayuda a un humilde pescador de las tierras colombianas con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Freddy has a very hardworking and adventurous spirit.  He has devoted himself to fishing for 14 years, with the goal of being able to get ahead, and build a good future alongside his family.

He is a responsible father of four young children, to whom he has always tried to offer the best education possible.

He works at his business every day, 12 hours a day, seeking a good catch.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a seine net and a casting net in order to make his fishing easier and improve his working conditions.

These elements will allow him to work more comfortably, and he will have a better production.  Help this humble fisherman from the land of Colombia with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase a seine net and a casting net.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 
Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de Sincelejo, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 
Cesar solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos de aproximadamente 70 kilos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 

Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 6 horas en distintas actividades, es un hombre rebuscador e inquieto
texts.en:
Cesar, a farmer with many dreams and aspirations in life, wants to help his family get ahead with the sweat from his brow. 

This is why he started his business of growing pigs, a common activity in the municipality of Sincelejo where not only does the price stand out but also the quality of the pigs that are grown there.

Cesar is asking for a loan to buy pigs of approximately 70 kilos. He will fatten then before selling them. His sole purpose is to advance and take care of his family who are the ones that raise his fighting and thriving spirit. 

He ardently works every day for 6 hours in different activities; he is an enterprising man who takes on any temporary work.

loans.use: to buy pigs of approximately 70 kilos

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela es una mujer de 52 años de edad, separada y madre de dos hijos. 
Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por como ropa, calzado y accesorios; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su hogar. 
Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 
Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía (ropa, perfumería, accesorios, lencería) con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 
Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Maricela is a 52 year old separated mother of two children. She currently earns a living by selling merchandise like clothing, footwear, and accessories. She began this business with the support of her family. She has managed to earn income to support the livelihood of her home with this business.

She is a hardworking, entrepreneurial person. She wants to succeed and go about her business.

She is requesting a loan from Corporación Interactuar to invest in buying assorted merchandise (clothing, perfumes, accessories, lingerie) to have to opportunity to increase her sales by offering a greater variety of products to meet different tastes and demands from customers. They are mainly friends and neighbors. 

Her main dream is to have lots of variety, expand her customer base, and increase sales so that she can provide for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing, perfumes, accessories, and lingerie)

loans.name: Olmedo

texts.es:
Olmedo es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su moto a través de las veredas del municipio de Norcasia posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.
Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, vive con su esposa y es padre de un hijo al cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.
Solicita un préstamo para comprarse una nueva moto y asi poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y ofrecer un empleo.
Con este crédito podrá mejorar su vida y su trabajo, permitiéndole salir adelante con su familia.
Apoya a Olmedo con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Olmedo is a hardworking and organized man. He makes his living providing transportation services to people on his motorbike in the villages in the municipality of Norcasia, making possible the movement of people in different areas of the municipality. 

He is a friendly, helpful, and very enterprising man. He lives with his wife and is the father of a son for whom he has tried to always provide the best possible life. He is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike so he can offer better service and offer employment to another.

With this loan he can improve his life and work, allowing him to support his family.

Support Olmedo with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase a new motor taxi

loans.name: Estela Karen

texts.es:
Karen, de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, su compañero de vida trabaja como vigilante en una empresa de venta de concentrados, tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos tiene 4 años y el otro 3 meses de nacido; Karen, ha construido una casa en terreno de su madre.

Karen, siempre le ha gustado el trabajo, desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su madre en la compra y venta de pescado fresco.

Cuando Karen se acompañó se dedicó a trabajar en el mismo negocio de su madre, comprando y vendiendo pescado para ayudar en los gastos familiares.

Hace dos años tuvo la oportunidad de poner su propio negocio de preparación y venta de tortilla, desde entonces se ha dedicado a esta actividad, porque es muy lucrativa.

Karen, desde se levanta a las 3:00 de la mañana, para empezar a preparar todo, porque a las 7:00 de la mañana, tiene que salir a venderlo.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar lamina, clavos y madera para arreglar el lugar donde prepara las tortillas, ya que está echa de palmas de coco y la quiere reparar para no mojarse en la época lluviosa.

Los sueños de la Karen son, que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mejores oportunidad de las que ella tuvo.- También, quiere construir su casa de bloque, ya que la que tiene es de lámina y no es cómoda ni segura.
texts.en:
Karen is 31 years old and attended the local school until sixth grade.  Her spouse works as a custodian in a business that sells concentrates.  She has two children, one who is four years old and another who is three months old.  Karen built a house on her mothers land.

Karen has always enjoyed working.  From a very young age, she would help her mother buy and sell fresh fish.  When Karen married, she began working in the same business as her mother, buying and selling fish in order to help with the household expenses.  Two years ago, she had the opportunity to start her own business making and selling tortillas.  Since then, she has devoted herself to this business because it is very lucrative.  Karen wakes up at 3am in order to start preparing everything because at 7am, she has to go out to sell them.

The loan will be used to purchase sheet metal, nails and wood in order to repair the place where she makes her tortillas because it is made of palm trees and she wants to fix it so that she does not get wet during the rainy season.  Karen's dreams are for her children to attend school and have better opportunities than she had.  She also wants to build a brick house because the one she currently has is made of sheet metal and it is neither comfortable nor secure.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet metal, nails and wood to repair the area where she makes tortillas.

loans.name: Betim

texts.en:
Betim is married and the father of two children. For more than eight years now, he has been running his own coffee bar where he serves a variety of beverages to his customers. Betim provides the main source of income for his family and he works very hard in order to provide for them and meet their daily needs. He is a very pleasant man which has helped his business be successful so far with the younger generations who frequent his café daily. He is very happy to have achieved so much already. Betim started as a waiter and, after working for others, has now become the business owner. 

Betim is requesting a loan to renovate his café. This will be his first loan and he would like to make new changes to the style and ambience of his café in hopes of attracting new customers and increasing his business. Betim’s goal is to eventually open a full restaurant and serve food. He is very happy for this opportunity and support and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to renovate his café and change the style and the ambience

loans.name: 020103310002 Thôn Bắc Sơn Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Như operates a food stall selling fish sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to make fish sauce for sale.

Như is 44 years old, and she is married with 2 children.

Như is the group leader of the 020103310002 Thôn Bắc Sơn Hoằng Phụ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Như joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Như has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Như has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Như hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make fish sauce for sale

loans.name: 010101030004 Thôn Hợp Tân Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Nga is 49 years old and married with three children. For more than ten years, she has operated a food stall where she sells fish sauce. Nga lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of the 010101030004 Thôn Hợp Tân Hoằng Phụ solidarity group, which consists of five members. Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund For Poor women in 2013 to improve her business and she has successfully repaid two previous loans. Her main business hardship is the lack of capital.

Nga is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to make fish sauce to sell. With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain her successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make fish sauce to sell

loans.name: Geneta

texts.en:
Geneta raises and sells hogs. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She is a 40-year-old woman with four children. Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 4. She also engages in buying and selling newly-harvested rice. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years now.

Geneta has requested a loan to buy pig feed and have additional capital for her buy and sell business. This will improve the way she raises hogs. In a few months, she could sell healthy pigs. She could have enough capital to continue to finance her buy and sell business. With this, she could handle her finances and afford to provide healthy diets to the whole family.

In the future, Genta hopes that she would be able to continue to handle her sources of income properly to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and have additional capital for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Maria Lyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maria Lyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling livestock business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Maria Lyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell to customers.

Maria Lyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Priscilla, a youthful 55-year-old shosho (old mum) and a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu, in the central region of Kenya. Priscilla is happily married and together with her husband, is blessed with six lovely children. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes. She also keeps goats and poultry. Priscilla has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she says, “I have to do something for my family.” 

Priscilla mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. Priscilla is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable, and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Priscilla is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride a motorbike and help with farm work. 

Priscilla is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Her loan will help her achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Priscilla feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of her loan are astronomical. Priscilla will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and increase her income. With your loan, Priscilla will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her work and get some accessories for her work to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of her children.

loans.name: Mariela Sabina

texts.es:
Mariela con 44 años de edad es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Toda su vida fue criada en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano y complementa con la producción de leche, de algunas vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de plátano, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de Tierra Alta, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Mariela es una mujer seria, responsable, comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Mariela, 44, is married with 3 children.  She was raised in the country and has made her living from the land for most of her life.  She has her own farming business now: She grows plantains and keeps dairy cows for milk sales.  She sells her products in the market at Tierra Alta and her income covers the family's expenses.  

Mariela is a responsible woman, serious of purpose and committed to doing her best for her family and business.  She wants to get ahead and that's why she is applying for this loan.  She will use it to buy the supplies she needs--fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, etc.--to maximize her yields and, in turn, her income.

Mariela says that the investment is important for her family because it will lead to a steadily higher standard of living for the family and ensure that her children can stay in school and get the education they need for a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Nilson Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Nilson es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para surtir su almacén con gran cantidad de repuestos, de este modo podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nilson is an experienced auto and motorcycle mechanic.  He learned mechanics from both study and on-the-job training.  He has an auto and motorcycle repair business now and makes an extra income selling spare vehicle parts.  

Nilson is an honest, hard-working man who knows how important the vehicles he works on are to their owners.  That's why he strives to provide excellent service, one that his customers will value.  

Nilson is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his business with spare vehicle parts.  The investment will allow him to provide the products that his customers most want.

loans.use: to stock his vehicle parts business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Maria Bellanira

texts.es:
Maria, una mujer de 35 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 10 horas.
Buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.
De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.
Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.
Apoya a Maria con su negocio!
texts.en:
Maria is a 35 year old woman who has given up everything in life for the benefit of her family, hoping to get them ahead and overcome adversity together.  Thanks to the store that she has managed to open through a lot of effort, patience and sacrifice, she is able to earn an income with which to support her children.  She works by herself everyday, 10 hours a day.  

Hoping to be the best small business owner in the area, she is seeking a loan to purchase an assortment of goods including grains and groceries, that will allow her to increase her inventory. With this, she will be able overcome difficulties such as low sales and competition.  This loan will be a great opportunity to establish herself as the most productive shop owner in the neighborhood, and it will allow her to fulfill her longstanding dream of having her own house.  

Support Maria and her business!

loans.use: purchase an assortment of goods such as grains and groceries to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es:
Luz Angela es una mujer creativa, tierna, amigable que llega fácil a las personas, sus 4 hijos y su matrimonio dan una idea del nivel de madurez y responsabilidad de esta mujer que hoy quiere solicitar un crédito para impulsar su negocio de papelería, la razón es que se acerca la temporada escolar y universitaria y quiere tener toda clase de surtido para aprovechar este mes que es donde sus ventas se disparan.
Su mayor sueño es poder juntar dinero y comprar una vivienda para sus hijas.
texts.en: Luz Angela is a creative, caring and friendly woman who has a way with people.  Her four children and her marriage give an idea of the level of maturity and responsibility that the woman has.  She is seeking a loan to boost her stationary business.  The reason for the loan is because the school year is about to start and she wants to have all types of goods to take advantage of this month because it is when her sales are the highest.  Her biggest dream is to be able to save money and buy a house for her children.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of goods for the school season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop and expand her work, and now she is waiting for your help to get money to buy more things to sell.

loans.name: Douglas's Group

texts.en:
Douglas's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Douglas, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 24 years old, married, and he has 2 children. Douglas has been a farmer for 5 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Douglas isn't new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Douglas will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition because now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Douglas's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve their maize harvest.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“Now I have an opportunity to become the first person in my family to attend AUCA, though I’m in need of financial assistance to realize what have been a long-term goal for me and a dream for my family.

Till 2011 my father worked as a manager in one of the banks in our country, but then was fired illegally. Since then the financial situation of my family deteriorated sharply, because he was the only breadwinner in it. My father knew his job perfectly and was respectful by his colleagues. The happened issue worried us a lot and he is seeking for a new job, but it’s hard to find a good job for him as the unemployment rate in our country is so high.  My mother is a housewife. Sometimes, she goes to the local market and helps my aunt in implementation of man’s trousers. As we live in the village in Naryn region, we have livestock and we grow vegetable and fruit in our garden. According to the fact that our family’s income is not stable, we always save money on everything, since this amount is very small for a living.

After getting a Kiva loan, my goal is to continue to apply the same diligence to my collegiate studies as I have to this point, making education and service to others is my top priority. I will represent American University in Central Asia well during my years in the university and beyond. Please, know that this financial assistance will make a significant positive impact on my ability to continue in university and will greatly appreciated. I try to become an active member of the Society for university. I can assure you that I will be a dedicated professional that you will be proud to count among your ranks.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Rabeccah's Group

texts.en:
Rabeccah is 63 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always described as a very experienced farmer. Even though Rabeccah is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Rabeccah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago in 2011. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Rabeccah’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. So, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 30-year-old married man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin. He lives with his wife and three small kids; two sons and a daughter. He is a construction worker and gets a low income from this. Hamza would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Hamza took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Hamza will reduce the electricity usage in heating the water. Hamza appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Babak

texts.en:
Babak is a 52-year-old married man and is raising four children with his wife. His children study at school. He has been working in the agriculture sector for 25 years. He grows different vegetables and fruits in his garden. He is also involved in animal husbandry. His monthly income is 130 AZN. He sells all sorts of fruits in the  local bazaar. Babak is a hard worker. But now the lack of water creates a problem for him to grow vegetables.

Babak decided to buy a water pump to solve his family's problem. He plans to increase his business. This is his second loan. Babak applied for a loan of 1200 AZN from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to solve his family's problem.

loans.name: Samphas

texts.en:
Samphas is a 19-year-old freshman, who is from Kratie province in Cambodia. She majors in management at a university in a province. Her father is a fisherman, and her mother sells fish at a market. 

Samphas is lacking the finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year, so she has decided to take out a loan. The loan will help her to have enough money to cover the tuition expenses for a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, she dreams of having a good job in a company or organization so she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tuition expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers for the Internet cafe.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of four sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to buy a water purification machine for his house since the water in his area is not clean. 

Fawaz took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Fawaz will be able to provide clean water for his children. 

Fawaz appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en:
Shohida is a business woman. She was born in 1979. She lives in a rural area and is married. She has three children. She is a clever, kind and hardworking person. They have one pensioner in their family. 

Shohida works at home and by season she plants cotton. Because of the less rainy season, she cannot get enough plants. Her husband is an emigrant. The money which he earns is spent on everyday expenditures. The rate of exchange for his currency has gone down. The money which he brought is not covering expenditures. Shohida with her family planned to get a loan to buy coal for the winter season. She is planning to cover the loan with money that her husband will send. She needs your financial support.

loans.use: To buy coal for the winter season

loans.name: 020103150003 Thôn Bắc Sơn Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoan operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Hoan is 52 years old, and she is married with 3 children.

Hoan is the group leader of the 020103150003 Thôn Bắc Sơn Hoằng Phụ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoan has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hoan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hoan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en: Guljahon is a business woman who was born in 1976. She lives in a village and is married with three children. Her husband is a builder. She has had a business for about ten years. Guljahon has a business of agro-cattle breeding and has two big livestock. She hopes for support. She works hard and likes her business. She is planning to renovate her house. Guljahon is asking for financial support to buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thái Sơn 2, Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lâm has a manufacturing business, making wood furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to make wood furniture to sell.

Lâm is 41 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thái Sơn 2, Công Chính solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 1999, Lâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lâm has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lâm has been involved in her business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. 

With her business profit, Lâm hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to make wood furniture to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda lives in Dulag, Leyte. She sells gasoline on retail basis to the people in her area. She is a 59-year-old widow. She has nine children. Two of them are still attending school. To augment her income, she engages in a frozen goods vending business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of gasoline to resell. These additional stocks are the fuel that will allow her business to grow. These additional stocks would also help augment her income and start to become part of the normal operation of her livelihood. She could then afford to buy nutritious foods that are very essential in her day to day activities. 

In the future, Luzviminda would like to expand her business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of gasoline to resell

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is married and has three children; he is 29 years old.  

Zaid has two jobs: he has a small business of a junk shop, for which he wakes up early and uses his truck to go to collect the scrap. He also has a horse for plowing the ground, and he uses it on a seasonal basis during certain periods.

Zaid loves performing and has the ambition to reach the goal of becoming a famous actor; he met with some of the filmmakers to show them his talent in May, and perhaps he can begin to achieve his dream, as one of the directors asked Zaid to perform with his horse because he has experience in dealing with horses.

From here, Zaid began the journey to achieving his dream, and decided that the next step was to buy another horse—a female—to reach the summit in the shortest time. So he applied for a loan to buy a horse, and he will work with it for plowing land until the filmmaker asks him to appear in another series with his horses.

loans.use: To buy a horse and work with it for plowing land until the filmmaker asks him to appear in another series with his horses.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felisa is 59 years old.

Felisa has an egg retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale.

Felisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale.

loans.name: Lanny

texts.en:
Lanny is 30 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lanny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Lanny has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Lanny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Al- Manar2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Manar2. It consists of four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Nora is the leader of the group, and she is married with six children. Her husband works for a daily wage, which is not enough to cover the basic expenses of the family. Nora decided to help him in taking on some of the family financial responsibilities through opening a small cafeteria to sell simple drinks in her area. One of her children works there, but he doesn't have a lot of customers because the store lacks many of the materials, which are necessary to make different kinds of drinks. Nora turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank and took out a loan of 40,000 YER to purchase mangos, orangesw and other fruits to make drinks in the cafeteria and to resell.

Nora hopes to open a saving account in the bank that will help in enlarging the cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase mangos, oranges and other fruits to make drinks in the cafeteria and to resell.

loans.name: Xheladin

texts.en:
Xheladin is married and has 3 children. He earns a living from his new business, making furniture for kitchens and living rooms. He has gained a lot of experience over the years of working for someone else for a salary in this career, and he is now putting all of his knowledge into his own career. Xheladin has a lot of customers who have stayed with him while he transitioned to his own business because he is very professional and does very high quality work for them. He has a workshop at home that he is using for his new start up business, which helps him keep some of his costs and overhead expenses down. 

For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase material for his new start up business. He feels very optimistic about the success of his business from his past experience and established clients, and he is considered to be very talented. Since he is the main source of income for his family, he is thankful for the support and this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase material for his work for making furniture

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.en:
Aisuluu is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is her story:

“The value of education is something that I have understood since a very young age. My parents made a commitment early in my life to do everything within their power to instill in me the love of learning and an understanding of the importance of hard work and dedication. Later on, during my secondary and high school career until now, I have been receiving big support from my eldest brother.

Spending one exchange academic year in the USA gave me an opportunity to make improvements in myself and develop the other sides of me. As a result of my extremely active student life in Adrian High School, I was awarded with the Scholar Athlete award in Southeastern Conference, where I was honored with first place for participating in tennis. My maintained 3.25 better grade point average partly helped me to become the captain of my team and achieve the Sportsmanship Award. Also, I’ve been presented with varsity letters in swimming, gymnastics and tennis.

Moreover, taking volunteering clubs such as American National Honors Society, I have worked on a voluntary basis for the Alexander Elementary School in Michigan, Adrian for a month. My missions were accomplished as a co-teacher to physically and mentally handicapped children for three months, and as a reader to blind children.

All of the above are some tools I have collected. Although I have the right idea, these items won’t help me if I don’t have the money to study at AUCA, not just the place where I want to get my higher education, spending for that four more years, but the place where I will work hard and give all myself to truly get a quality education. This will help me to use it for the development of our beautiful and rich-ancient culture country.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her home appliances store

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 19-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mahmoud has a rickshaw where he works in transferring goods to the local traders. He buys them with at a low price from the wholesalers and then he resells them. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more general products for his business. This will increase his sales and his income. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo with his rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy more general products for his business

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en:
Izdehar is a 39-year-old married woman from Attell, a village near Tulkarm city. She is a mother for three sons and two daughters. All of them attend schools. Her husband works as a farmer on his agricultural land where he plants seasonal crops. Izdehar also has a chicken barn. It has been operating for the past two months.
 
It is a very good business and the whole family cooperates together in the work. 

Izdehar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to improve the barn condition and to expand it. By taking this loan, Izdehar will be able to improve her business and increase the income. 

Izdehar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to improve the barn condition and to expand it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new engine for his agricultural tractor for his business.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 35-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He is a father of one son and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Imad would like to buy a water purification machine for his house since the water in his area is not clean. He took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family's house. By taking this loan, Imad will be able to provide clean water for his children.
 
Imad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family's house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for heating water, and a tank.

loans.name: Mureed

texts.en:
Mureed is a 22-year-old single man from a village near Qalqilia city in the West Bank. 

Mureed's father is a retired employee, and his brother works as an employee in a local firm. Mureed opened a barber shop in his village last year. It is a very good business, and the demand is high.

Mureed has taken a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop. By taking this loan, Mureed will be able to both improve his business and attract more clients.

Mureed appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1987, is married with 2 children, and lives in a rural area. 

Nargiza's husband works planting crops. She and her husband work together on their land cultivating rice. Additionally, they keep livestock, and they have about 30 large cattle in stock rotation.  

Nargiza needs to cover their expenditures for agricultural products, so she is requesting financial support to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. 

Nargiza awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Sosima

texts.en:
Sosima is 50 years old, married and has one child.

Sosima is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sosima has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 21-year-old, single lady living in Irbid. She is a third-year student in university and is majoring in Arabic language.

She is one of five family members, so her parents face some financial problems that led Rasha to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees.

Rasha’s future plan is to find good work, so she can help her brothers to complete their study.

Rasha needs your support.

loans.use: to pay for covering her semester fees.

loans.name: Upendo Kerwa Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Upendo Kerwa Women Group. She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of three children. 

Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s trainings in enterprise management have helped her realize her strength in business, making her engage in a full-time business of tailoring. The demand for her product has grown, making her apply for a loan to cater to the rising demand by buying fabric material and sewing thread. This will increase her profit margin, thus ensuring food security in her household.

Jane is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fabric material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs for slaughter and to sell

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a married woman, 41 years old. She is a conservative woman and asked her daughter Farah to take her place in the photo. Raeda has two children, and she lives in Amman. Raeda wants to see her children become successful people in the future, so she is fighting all obstacles she faces to pay the education fees for her children. 

She has a daughter named Farah, who is 21 years old, and she is studying at the university in the fourth year majoring in management information systems. Raeda is dreaming of the day when Farah will graduate, and she will be proud too. Raeda has asked for an educational loan to help pay the semester fees for Farah due to an inability to pay her fees.

loans.use: To pay the semester fees for her daughter Farah due to an inability to pay her fees.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 19-year-old single lady who started working as a tutor from her house one year ago. She earns an income not sufficient to cover her needs and expenses.

Today, Maysaa is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development in order to cover the cost of necessary dental treatments. 

Maysaa hopes to finish her studies and expand her business so she can both increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the cost of necessary dental treatments.

loans.name: Shakarjon

texts.en: This is Shakarjon. She is a 58-year old divorced woman with two adult children. She lives in the Spitamen district and is engaged in agriculture. She rents a 1 hectare plot of land, on half of which she is sowing wheat, and on the rest of the land, she is sowing corn. Shakarjon loves animals and for 20 years has kept cattle in her yard for the needs of the family. Now she is planning to start a livestock business, i.e. buying and selling cattle. Shakarjon stocked fodder and is taking out a loan to buy a few young calves to start a business. In the future, she plans to expand her new business. Shakarjon believes and hopes for support from your side. This loan will help her to open a new source of income and to improve the economic situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a number of young calves.

loans.name: Mayramhon

texts.en: Mayramhon is a businesswoman. She was born in 1956. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. Her husband works at a school. She has a business of livestock keeping. She is a bright, cheerful and honest person. Mayramhon has four cattle in stock rotations. About twenty years ago, she started her business. She works hard and does well in her business. She is planning to hold the wedding party of her daughter but she does not have money. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en:
Rukhshona is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1995. She lives in a village with her family. She is single.

She is doing a business of keeping livestock. Additionally, she works as a nurse. She has good practice. She has four big cattle in stock rotation.

She wants to be helpful for her family. She decided to buy plastic doors and windows for the apartment. She is asking for financial support for buying plastic windows and doors.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows and doors for her family's apartment.

loans.name: Roberto Efraín

texts.es:
Roberto, de 28 años de edad, está acompañado, estudió hasta séptimo grado, se dedica a la pesca artesanal, tiene un hijo de 6 meses de nacido y su compañera de vida es cosmetóloga.

Roberto, desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la pesca artesanal, ya que toda su familia realiza ésta actividad.- Lo hace casi todos los días de la semana por las noches hasta el amanecer, ya que en esta hora es más fácil la extracción del pescado, luego los entrega a los revendedores de la zona. 

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar una lancha, ya que la que utiliza es rentada y tiene que pagar diario el alquiler y en ocasiones no extrae peces y tiene que pagar de sus ahorros.- Además, quiere ayudar a su compañera de vida en la compra de materiales para la cosmetología.

Roberto, en un futuro sueña con lograr comprar un terreno, donde pueda mandar a construir su casa ya que en la que vive es de su hermana y también, desea ayudar a su esposa a poner su propio negocio como estilista.
texts.en:
Roberto, 28, has a partner and studied up to 7th grade. He earns a living through traditional fishing methods. He has a 6 month old son and his partner is a cosmetologist. 

Roberto has been a fisherman since he was very young since his entire family does this work. He fishes almost every day of the week at night until dawn. This is the easiest time to catch fish. Later he brings them to the re-sellers in the area. 

The loan will be used to buy a boat. Currently he rents a boat and has to pay a daily rental fee and sometimes he does not catch any fish and has to pay out of his savings. He also wants to help his partner buy cosmetology supplies. 

In the future, Roberto dreams of being able to buy some land and build a house since he currently lives with his sister. He also wants to help his wife set up her own salon.

loans.use: to buy a boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour and cheese so he can keep his bakery open.

loans.name: Yenifer Adriana

texts.es:
Ella es Yennifer una joven madre cabeza de familia de tan solo 24 años de edad, que debido a su hijo de 2 años tuvo que abandonar muchos sueños que se había trazado para cumplirlos a través del estudio.
La responsabilidad de mantener a su hija y brindarle una buena calidad de vida recae en ella, pues su pareja la abandono, logra salir adelante gracias a la venta de alimento, prepara almuerzos, desayunos y pasa bocas, pero no es suficiente y por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar un venta de comidas rápidas, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carro de comidas rápidas, mesas, sillas, utensilios de cocina, insumos, estufa industrial.
Apoya a esta joven que quiere demostrar que puede ejercer los dos papeles y que mientras esté viva nunca nada le faltara a su hija.
texts.en:
Yennifer is a young head of household mother. She is only 24. Due to her 2 year old daughter she had to give up on many dreams which included studying. 

The responsibility to provide her daughter with a good quality of life falls solely on her since her partner left her. 

She is able to get ahead by selling food. She prepares lunches, breakfasts and snacks. However, it is not enough which is why she is requesting a loan so she can start a business selling fast food. 

She will invest the loan in a food truck, tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, supplies and an industrial stove. 

Support this young woman so she can show that she is able to do both roles. And, as long as she is living, her daughter will never need anything.

loans.use: to buy a food truck, tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, supplies and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Al- Insha Group

texts.en:
Al- Insha is a group made up of one woman and three men who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a 290,000 YER loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Fathia is the group leader, and she is married with four children, living in a small house in a poor quarter. She is an educated woman and works in the private sector earning a small salary. 

The house where Fathia and her family live lacks many home appliances, while the ones they have are very old. Together, Fathia's and her husband's incomes are not enough to improve their living conditions. As a result, she has applied for her 80,000 YER loan portion from AMB in order to purchase some necessary home appliances.

Fathia hopes to open a sewing shop where she can work.

loans.use: to purchase some necessary home appliances.

loans.name: Dastan

texts.en:
Dastan is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of European Studies. Here is his story:

“I am from Toguz-Toro village of Jalal-Abad region in Kyrgyzstan. We are six in our family: my parents, my older and younger brother, my younger sister and me.

My father is the only breadwinner in our family. There is a lack of work in the village, as after the USSR collapse, many factories were destroyed or closed, and people began farming and growing livestock. We also have a small field, where we grow vegetables and fruits for ourselves and for sale, which serves as an additional income for us. My mother is unemployed due to her health and does household work. My elder brother is a student at the university, and the other two siblings are schoolchildren. Unfortunately, there is no work for students at all, and even many people with high education are forced to migrate to Russia in order to support their families.

I am a smart and hardworking student. I do believe that a university education is necessary and decided to apply for a Kiva loan to be able to get a degree at AUCA.

One of the main reasons for my choosing AUCA is that there is no corruption in it, and students are strongly judged just according to their academic performance and efforts. This gives a chance to me to be one of the best students of AUCA and reach my goals. After graduation, I don’t want to be one of thousands in my country who have a diploma and can’t find a job. AUCA provides its students with the best knowledge and critical thinking, gives them a chance to do an internship abroad, and enables them to continue studies at the Western universities; (this is) what really attracts me.

I know that a Kiva loan makes a difference for poor people and hope it won’t pass over me.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 19-year-old married mother of one child who started two years ago selling fruits and vegetables to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.
