El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y podrá tener un mejor tiempo de producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus hijos.

Yerson espera tu colaboración para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos!
texts.en:
Yerson, aged 29, has chosen to set up a food business near his home, which is located in the municipality of Medellin. He sells baked goods at his business.

Yerson works with his wife (see photo) from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. every day. He is a very responsible man, determined, and devoted to his business.

One of his dreams is to be able to have a restaurant in which he can offer different types of food and provide employment.

He faces several difficulties such as the cost of supplies, the competition in the area, and the heavy rains that hit his food stall.

He is requesting a loan to capitalize his business and buy an electric mill.

The loan will have a most favourable impact on his life and business because it will allow him to fulfill his goal of improving his production time to serve his customers. Moreover, his children depend on this business.

Yerson hopes to have your support to improve his quality of life and that of his children!

loans.use: to capitalize his business and buy an electric mill.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz amparo es una mujer muy luchadora y capaz, que a pesar de que se dejó con su esposo, encontrándose en una muy complicada condición económica, saco fuerza y con ahorros y préstamos ha conformado un almacén donde oferta calzado y ropa para dama.
Luz Amparo quiere explorar un nuevo mercado y por ende solicita un crédito para comprar ropa de la línea de bebe, con la que espera diversificar sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas, diversificar las ofertas de productos.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is a determined and able woman, despite that she left her husband, leaving her in a very complicated financial position, she drew strength and with savings and loans she has opened a shop where she offers footwear and clothes for women.
Luz Amparo wants to explore a new market and so she is asking for a loan to buy clothes from a baby clothing line with which she hopes to diversify her range of customers, improve her sales and diversify the products she offers.

loans.use: to buy clothes from a baby clothing line in order to diversify her supply to clients.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Ella es Elvia una mujer de gran sonrisa, una veterana de 54 años de edad que un día sufrió una gran pérdida, su esposo murió dejándola sola sin algún hijo.
Elvia con la ayuda de su negocio que conformo el cual se trata de una distribuidora de bebidas, más puntualmente cerveza ha podio solventar sus necesidades y llevar a su mesa un plato de comida.
Su idea es poder expandirse tener distribuidoras en otros sitios, aumentar sus clientes, sus ventas, mejorar su calidad de vida.
Elvia solicita un crédito para la compra de gaseosas y cervezas, no puedes dejar que esta mujer siga sola, apóyala
texts.en: Elvia is a woman with a big smile. She is an experienced 54 year old woman who suffered a great loss when her husband died, leaving her without any children. With the help of her business, which consists of the distribution of beverages, in particular beer, she has been able to cover her needs and bring a plate of food to her table. Her idea is to expand this distributorship to other locations, to increase her client base, and to improve her quality of life. Elvia is asking for a loan to buy carbonated beverages and beers. You can't allow this woman to do this by herself, please support her.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of carbonated beverages and beers. She dreams of expanding her distributorship business.

loans.name: By His Grace Group

texts.en:
"By His Grace"  group consists of five people who live in the same neighborhood. They sell soft drinks, grocery items, plates, glasses, tea, bread, noodles, and salad. 

Cecilia is the  featured borrower of this group. She is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school. Cecilia lives  with her family in Chorkor. 

Cecilia helps her husband to take care of the family and contributes to pay the family's expenses. Cecilia has sold tea, noodles, bread, and salad at her residence at Chorkor for 8 years.  This business enables her to provide for herself and her children. She buys Milo, Lipton tea, milk, sugar, noodles,  and vegetables to prepare tea and salad to sell. Cecilia hopes to improve service to her customers and requests a ninth loan from ID-Ghana. The previous loans were successfully repaid. They need a total amount of 11,600 GHS to expand their business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy Milo, Lipton tea, milk, sugar, noodles and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive plants.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She has worked  packaging cereals for three years.  This helps her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their family. 

Mariam and her husband have limited income, not enough to cover all their family's needs.  they are trying desperately to improve their family's living conditions.  Mariam requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy new bedroom furniture for her child. She hopes to continue to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 31-year-old married man from the city of  Deir El balah. He lives with his wife and three children in a small simple house. He is employed in the public sector and earns a very low income. Ashraf  has a stall to sell hot drinks and earn additional income. He earns a good income which supports the family and covers part of their expenses.

Ashraf took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new stall for his business. Ashraf will improve his work and would like to open a cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new stall for his business.

loans.name: Paula Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive  la señora Paula, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 10 y 9  años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Paula es una muy buena madre y esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido  lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica  a la venta de pescado, todos los días el se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta lugar donde compra el mejor  pescado ya sea albacoras, picudos que son para vender por libras o también variedades de pescado pequeño los mismos que son de mucho agrado para sus clientes además por ser más económicos, el recorre la ciudad en un triciclo ofreciendo sus productos,  lleva más de 19 años en este negocio el cual le da lo necesario para sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado en todas las variedades. Lleva más de 14 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener un carro para vender el pescado.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Calle América” meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is also known for its famous straw hats. 

Paula, age 33, lives here. She is married and from this relationship has three children, ages 14, 10, and 9. The eldest studies in high school and the youngest two are in elementary school. Her husband is a businessman.

Paula is a very good mother and wife who takes out this loan so that her husband can use it in his business. He works selling fish. Everyday he travels to the city of Manta where he buys the best fish, be it “albacoras” or “picudos,” that are sold by the pound or also varieties of small fish that are very well liked by his customers and are more affordable. 

He travels around the city on a tricycle offering his products. He has been in this business for over 19 years, and it gives him what is necessary to get his family ahead. This loan is to buy fish of all varieties. Paula has more than 14 years in the communal bank and she likes it because with the loans they can get ahead. Their dreams are to have a car to sell the fish.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Babrah

texts.en:
Babrah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She is also looking after her grandfather.
She has operated a kiosk selling soft drinks at retail in the market for the last 10 years, working seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses.

She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to stock more crates of soda, beer, oranges, pineapple, and passionfruit for making juice for sale. Her challenges include thieves. Her dream is to get a better kiosk to operate her business. She joined MCDT because of timely loans. She and her husband live in her own house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To stock crates of soda, beer, oranges, passionfruit, and pineapple

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with nine children, five of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

Tereza has been operating a retail shop for the last four years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.mShe has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to enable her to stock more soda, sugar, flour, cereals, drinking water and detergents for sale. Her challenges include transportation. Her dream is to put up her own premises from which to carry out her business. She joined MCDT because it was relatively easy to join.

She is residing in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy soda, sugar, flour, cereals, boxes of water and detergents

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 49-year-old Lebanese widow living with three children.

Due to the fact that Maha is the sole bread winner for the family, 5 years ago, she started to work in the agricultural field to earn sufficient income to support her children. She owns a small plot of land which she cultivates. She sells her harvests to multiple customers and neighbouring vendors.

Since Maha needs financial support to continue producing a good quantity of provisions, she is presently seeking a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. She will use it to purchase seeds and plants so she can grow more products.

Maha’s only concern is to raise her children and provide them with the minimum needs of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a hardworking married father who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His 3 children are aged 17, 14, and 10 years. He used his previous loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm. 

Justus currently deals in welding as his main source of income. He started this business to earn a living and educate his children. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands for his products. He has a vision of becoming a prominent businessman.  

Justus is requesting a loan to buy more items such as metal bars to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as metal bars to add to his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Peresperu

texts.en:
Peresperu is a 54-year-old married father. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where he operates a retail shop as his main source of income. But he also rears livestock to earn additional income. 

Peresperu has the goal of becoming a prominent businessman. However, he is limited by inadequate capital and market price fluctuations. He works hard to educate all of his children. 

Peresperu is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his business such as soap, drinks, jugs, and basins to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his business like soap, drinks, jugs, and basins.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy soap, sugar and other items for his shop. Thomas has fulfilled his personal goals of educating his children and has built a permanent home. Although Thomas has a main hardship of competition, he has hopes of owning a big wholesale shop in the near future. 

He intends to use the loan to buy more items to stock in his shop, especially soap, sugar, salt, crates of sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to stock in his shop, especially soap, sugar, salt, crates of sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Milio

texts.en: Milio is a 28-year-old married male with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Milio has operated a shop of general merchandise for six years now. He also practices farming, growing crops such as maize, beans, rice and others to earn a living. Milio has a dream of expanding his business and educating his children to attain a minimum qualification. However, he is faced with the challenge of competition and limited capital. Milio wants money to buy a refrigerator for soft drinks to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for soft drinks to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to floor his family house.

loans.name: Perla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa cálida se muestra la humildad de Perla, quien habla con pasión sobre el crecimiento de su negocio de fritanga y de venta de frutas. Desde un principio ella expresa su agradecimiento con KIVA, con MiCrédito y con todas las personas que le extendieron la mano en el préstamo anterior, con el cual pudo comprar golosinas y comida en grandes cantidades, teniendo como resultado un gran incremento de ingresos.
Perla de 38 años de edad, se siente muy motivada como madre soltera de cuatro hijos a cargo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar una cocina, carne cruda y aceite, herramientas que necesita para ofrecer un producto de calidad. Al cancelar este crédito considera optar por uno nuevo ya que quiere seguir emprendiendo junto con su familia.
texts.en: Perla's humility is reflected in her warm smile. She speaks with passion about the growth of her fried food and fruit stand business. From the beginning, she expressed gratitude to KIVA, to MiCredito, and to all the people who helped her with the last loan. With it, she was able to buy candy bars and food in big quantities, resulting in a significant increase in earnings. Perla is 38 years old, she is very motivated as a single mother of 4 children under her care. She is asking for a new loan to buy a stove, raw meat and oil, items needed to offer a quality product. Upon paying off this loan, she will consider taking a new loan to be able to continue growing along with her family.

loans.use: To buy a stove, raw meat and oil.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 20-year-old single man, living in Mafraq, his father has retired.

He is studying business management and likes his major. He hope to work in banking and asks for a loan to pay his semester fees, because his father’s income is not enough to pay for his fees and support his four siblings.

loans.use: to pay for his fees.

loans.name: Rohit

texts.en: Rohit is 46 years old and lives  with his wife and 2 school-aged children. He raises chickens to sell. Rohit needs to save for his children's education and  future. He wants to buy more chickens and expand his poultry business so he can sell more and save money for future expenses..

loans.use: to expand his poultry business.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo is a young resident of Qubadiyon district. She is 29 years old, married, and  has three daughters who are 9, 7 and 1 year old. 

Dilrabo has a retail outlet at the market place and wants to sell shoes. Dilrabo does not have the money to purchase shoes and requests  a loan to start this business. She wants to provide her family with a source of income. Dilrabo is also in agriculture and has a small plot of land. 

The loan will help her to start a new business and improve the lives of her family. Please support her in this endeavor.

loans.use: to start a shoe business.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 25-year-old single woman from Lebanon. At the age of 20, she started to work as a private tutor, welcoming students at her house. She is requesting a loan from Kiva through Vitas s.a.l in order to purchase an educational encyclopedia, as she seeks expansion and development in her career. Rajaa is an extroverted person and always seeks more expansion in her business. In the future, Rajaa says that she will ask for additional Kiva loans, as she is sure that she will attend higher levels in her life thanks to the funds.

loans.use: to purchase an educational encyclopedia

loans.name: Yassmine

texts.en: Yassmine is a 28-year-old Lebanese woman who is married and lives with one child and her husband, who is the main provider for the family. She is a private teacher who has been in this profession for two years and has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to buy a laptop. Yassmine says that this equipment will improve her teaching skills, especially regarding the topics and exercises she teaches. In the future, she seeks to get additional Kiva loans in order to better arrange the area where she teaches her private students.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 19-year-old, Lebanese single woman, living with her parents and two relatives. Recently, she started to work at her domicile as a private teacher. She is very hospitable and treats her students in a pleasant way. 

Currently, Zeinab is eager to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., since she wants to purchase a laptop with the purpose of expanding her background and making her preparations easier to complete.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 31-year-old woman from Lebanon. She has three children and lives with her husband who works in the Lebanese army. Zahraa puts forth a great effort in her life to help the family members meet their needs. She is a private teacher and she also makes artisanal and embroidery work. She works all day to eventually receive enough revenue.  

Zahraa looks forward today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a laptop to enhance her teaching skills, as well as some textile needed to increase her handmade production. Zahraa is an optimistic person seeking the best for her family even with the hard effort she is putting in.

loans.use: purchase a laptop

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en: Rabab is a 21-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her mother. Rabab is the main income provider for the family, and works day and night to support her mother and be able to live in good conditions. She is a private teacher working at her house where she receives students. Rabab lacks a laptop, a tool that can help her a lot in her teaching ways, especially in expanding her knowledge and broadening her educational background. To acquire it, she is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Rabab is confident that the Kiva loan will help her achieve her goal, which is becoming an expert in teaching and getting hired at a reputable school earning satisfactory profits.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia Elsa pertenece al banco comunal QORI SONQO,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca ,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 42 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia Elsa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en: Elsa is a member of the communal bank QORI SONQO. The bank is located in the district of Calca, province of Calca, in the department of Cusco. The member is 42 years old.  She has a common law spouse and she has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities by focusing in agriculture. It has been several years since she works in this business, and it is going very well thanks to her dedication to her work. She wants to continue working so that she can continue helping her family. This time, Elsa needs a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her semester tuition fees.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He is 71-year-old and has 4 children. He is a hard working man  who buys and raises cattle. He earns additional income selling dairy products. He started this business because there was demand for cattle in the surrounding area. 

He dreams of building a home for his children and turning the business into a large cattle trade to supply the butcher shops in surrounding towns. He is faced with price changes. Christopher needs a loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.en:
Emeliane is a 43-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 10 and 14 years old.  Both attend school. 

She belongs to the  Dukore group which  means “Worker” in English. The members of the group sell different products and their common goal is to improve their business to ensure a better future. She has run a business for 4 years. She will use the loan to buy sugar, salt, and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Omorden Bor Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Omorden bor.  Their average age of 45 years. They sell grocery items, hair products, wigs,  and eggs. 

Ama-Fuastina is a 34-year-old married woman with four children and supplies eggs at her residence in Chorkor. She buys the eggs from the poultry farmers. She has been a member of this group for five years and needs this loan to expand her business. 

This is her eighth successive loan cycle and she has been able to  save money and has improved business tremendously.  She has a secondary level of education but decided to join her friend and learn how to trade. Ama-Fuastina stands second from the left in the photo, sample products are on the table.

She need 3,000 GHS to purchase 215 crates of eggs.

Together with her colleagues, they need a total of 9,700 GHS to be able to expand their businesses.  They hold each other responsible for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase 215 crates of eggs.

loans.name: Nawunchalikazee Shirikpamo/bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Ayi is a 75-year-old hardworking woman from Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. Ayi is married and has six children. Ayi is the individual pictured with both hands placed on a basin of paddy rice among members who are squatting.

Ayi is a member of a parboiled-rice-processing group that has been in business for the last seven years. The name of the group is Nawunchalikazee Shirikpamo/Bimbilla. She earns a good profit from the business simple because the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high-quality parboiled rice for the local markets around Bimbilla and the non-local markets.

Ayi and Nawunchalikazee Shirikpamo/Bimbilla group have asked for a loan of GHS 13,100. Ayi’s share of the loan is GHS 500, which would be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Ayi aspires to produce in large quantities in the future and earn more income, as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and her children's educational needs.

Ayi thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 54-year-old hardworking man who lives in Ishaka in the Bushenyi District. He is an old customer of UGAFODE Microfinance, having borrowed twice from the same institution. He is married and he has seven children aged 30, 28, 26, 24, 21, 19 and 17. 

Fred has and operates a restaurant in Ishaka town along Kabirisi Road. This is his major source of income, boosted by the butchery business. He started the business in the year 2007 with much hope that the business would grow into a big business and he would then be in position to get relatively big profits. 

He would like to use a loan of 5,000,00 UGX to buy goats, which he would slaughter and get income. His major customers are the people in his area of operation who go to the restaurant to buy food, and those who go to his butchery for meat. 

Fred’s hopes for the future include growing his business into a much bigger hotel where he can serve more people and get more profits, which would help him to cater for the needs of his big family. He is mainly faced with a challenge of stiff competition since there are many restaurants in his area of operation, but his welcoming, honest and good personality have helped him to beat the competition. He strongly believes that his business will thrive if given the loan.

loans.use: To buy goats for slaughter

loans.name: Israel

texts.en: Israel is a single man with no children. He lives at his parent's house at La paz in Israel and is working for the Bolivian government in one of their institutions. His salary is not so big, so he needs to have an occupation in his free time. As a result, he needs a loan to buy a laptop and a printer for his little business in systems consultancy. He will appreciate your help again

loans.use: to buy a laptop and a printer

loans.name: Macadamia Group

texts.en:
Olintepeque is a small community outside the large town of Quetzaltenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The climate is quite cool here. The majority of the population is Maya-kiche. They are very proud of their culture and wear their traditional clothing that is quite beautiful and colorful.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Macadamia” was formed in Olintepeque by seven ladies. One of them is Damaris, who is a single mother of two children. At 31 years of age, she is very motivated and hardworking. Her time in school was interrupted when she gave birth to her first child. Damaris had to find work and was unable to secure formal employment, so she decided to sell used American clothing. Somewhat later, she decided to open a bookstore. The business has been growing, as it is close to a school. 

Damaris dreamed of even more expansion and joined the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank to obtain a loan to maintain her copy machine. She decided to buy school supplies, and purchased pencils, pencil sharpeners, crayons and notebooks. Damaris was pleased as children were returning to school; the little store had a great location on the side of a school and there were increased sales. 

Happily, Damaris is requesting another loan that will be her third. She is hopeful that Kiva investors will learn about her and her goals and fund her loan. The six other ladies in the “Macadamia” Trust Bank are hopeful as well.  Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy school supplies: pencils, pencil sharpeners, crayons and notebooks

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.en:
Vida, meaning life, is a group of women who received a loan through Kiva in December last year, and they are thankful for that opportunity. Now with lots of success, this group has finished paying off that loan and they are requesting a new one, because their businesses have grown and/or are maintaining, but they still need additional capital.

Estela is a 36 year-old woman who lives in the Western Highlands in Quetzaltenango, the second largest city in Guatemala.  She has a primary school education.  Since she was young, Estela has been involved in textile production and creates the beautiful and traditional textiles of the area.  Over the years, she has managed to save toward investing in more merchandise inventory in order to increase her income.  However, now she needs to invest long term and so she has joined the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Vida. Currently, Estela is beginning a new loan cycle and needs to have a loan to buy blouses, belts, shawls and typical skirts in order to increase her sales and generate more income.  She has two goals: to continue to provide an education for her four adolescent children and improve her home.

The Trust Bank Vida is made up of six others ladies who have developed relationships with each other that are supporting and trusting. They meet once each month with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who spends a portion of the meeting sharing useful and important information with them. In order to successfully manage their loans, the ladies learn about effective business practices (business design, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service and accounting). They learn how to more effectively care for themselves and their families with newly acquired knowledge about nutrition, hygiene and health. The ladies also learn about self-esteem, violence against women and sexual abuse. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it is truly effective.

loans.use: to buy blouses, belts, shawls and typical skirts

loans.name: Paraje Tzancoral Group

texts.en:
The community of Santa Lucia La Reforma is nestled between thick, green pine trees in the Southwestern Highlands of Guatemala. It is quiet and quite picturesque, with adobe homes and buildings. 

Nine women have gathered together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank's 'Paraje Tzancoral Group' with the goals of expanding their businesses, raising their standards of living, and providing education for their children. The women have an average age of 41 years and average slightly less than two years of formal education. The members of the Trust Bank have various businesses, including tortillerías (tortilla shops where tortillas are freshly made three times each day), convenience stores, and food sales (vegetables, chicken), as well as animal husbandry (chickens).

Juana, a 33 year-old mother of two children, is the President of the Trust Bank. This gives her the opportunity to practice and increase her leadership skills. She owns a small convenience store and the earnings from the business allow her to support her young family. 

She is requesting a loan that she will use to increase inventory of the store and purchase essential items, like oil, rice, beans, pasta, juices, and soft drinks, as well as dish soap, laundry soap, and body soap. In addition, Juana would like to purchase two calves to raise, to generate income in the long run.

All the women of the Trust Bank's Paraje Tzancoral Group are most appreciative to Kiva investors for funding their loans. They face a brighter tomorrow, empowering themselves and eliminating poverty from their lives.

loans.use: to increase inventory of the store, purchasing essential items, like oil, rice, beans, pasta, juices, and soft drinks, as well as dish soap, laundry soap, and body soap.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. 

Catherine has operated a business from home, selling yellow bananas and tomatoes, for the past six years. She generates additional income through selling onions and tomatoes and from renting rooms. She works seven days a week and sells both on a retail and a wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and paying for electricity.

Catherine has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas and boxes of tomatoes. She aspires to educate her children through to university.

loans.use: To buy bunches of yellow bananas and boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all attending school, and takes care of additional family members. For the last 2 years, Peninah has sold fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She earns additional income selling running water. Peninah works seven days a week. 

Peninah has requested 2,400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy greens, watermelons, cabbages, pineapples, onions and tomatoes. Her major challenges include customers who do not pay their bills and weather conditions. She wants to educate her children to the university level. Peninah lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy greens, watermelons, cabbages, pineapples and tomatoes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with five children. Four of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a retail shop that she rents at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people at the market. She has been in business for six years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda, sugar, rice, flour, and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity. She aspires to build a residential home. She resides in a rented house where the family have access to electricity but not running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, sugar, rice, flour, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of her brother. Grace and her family live in a rented house and have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. Grace has had her restaurant business for six years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.

Grace has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken and charcoal.  She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken and charcoal.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. Janet has a clinic businessand has been in this business for eight years. She generates additional income from working in a restaurant. Janet has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tablets, syrups and syringes. She works from a shop that she rents seven days out of every week, and she sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. Janet aspires to turn her clinic into a fully stocked health centre and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, where the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tablets, syrups and syringes.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia Aurelia pertenece al banco comunal QORI SONQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 39 años de edad es soltera  y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de verduras como zanahorias, tomates entre otros, ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar zanahorias al por  mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Aurelia belongs to the "QORI SONQO" communal bank, which is located in the district and province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, is single, and has two children. She alternates her daily chores with her business selling vegetables such as carrots and tomatoes, among other products. She has been running this business for many years now, and she is doing very well because of her hard work. She wants to be able to keep on working so that she can continue to support her family.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy carrots wholesale.

She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots wholesale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a bar. She works seven days a week from home. She has been in this business for the ten years. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more crates of  beer, a jerrycan of local brew and spirits. Her biggest business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a refrigerator. She lives in rented house and the family has no access to electricity or running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy spirits, crates of beer and a jerrycan of local brew

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal QORI SONQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 48 años de edad es separada  y tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar transporte el socio lleva buen tiempo   dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio  se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Florentino is a member of the Communal Bank Qori Sonqo. The bank is located in the district of Calca in the Calca province and department of Cusco. He is 48 years old, is separated and has 2 children. His daily activities are spent earning a living by providing transportation. He has been in this business for a good while, and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. He wants to be able to continue working so that he can keep supporting his family.

At this time, Florentino is requesting a loan to perform maintenance on his car. He feels grateful for the loan, and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. Annet rents a house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.  

Annet has a food stall where she sells fruits and vegetables. She operates her business on a retail basis and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Annet has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, onions and sweet potatoes.  Her goal and aspiration is to start growing food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, onions and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia Clotilde se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de refrescos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los refrecos.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar refrescos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Clotilde continues working selling soft drinks. The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She wants to get ahead by continuing in this business. Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to purchase soft drinks. She is happy for the loan, and she is committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Lucrecia Feliza

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Lucrecia, tiene 55 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  viven en su casa, su esposo trabaja de conserje en un colegio.
Doña Lucrecia tiene una panadería en su casa, allí junto a sus hijos todos los días preparan delicioso pan, ellos también prepara tortas y bizcochuelos y helados de varios sabores que son muy apetecidos por sus clientes y que ella vende en su local o también sale a vender en lugares donde se reúnen las personas, esto le deja muy buenos ingresos ya que se venden muy bien. Trabajan todos los días, desde las 5h00  hasta las 15h00, su esposo también les ayuda sobre todo los fines de semana cuando está desocupado, llevan en este negocio por más de 13 años y les va muy bien ya que cuentan con muy buena clientela.
Este crédito lo van a utilizar en comprar harina, sal, azúcar y otros ingredientes necesarios para elaborar el pan y sus deliciosos helados. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener otro local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Calle America communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi region, an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts that are recognized at the national and international levels. This is the place with the famous straw hats.

This is where Lucrecia, age 55, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage and has five children, all of whom are grown. Two of them live in her house. Her husband works as a school janitor.

Lucrecia has a bakery in her home. There, along with her children, she prepares delicious bread every day. They also prepare cakes, sponge cakes, and ice creams in a variety of flavors, which her customers love to eat. She sells from her home, and she also goes out to sell in places where people gather because this generates good revenues because they sell very well. They work every day from 5:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.  Her husband also helps her every weekend when he is not busy. They have had this business for more than 13 years, and it is going very well for them because they have very good clientele.

They will use this loan to purchase flower, salt, sugar, and other basic items that are needed to make the bread and the delicious ice creams. She has been in her communal bank for four years, and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her.

Her dream is to have another shop in the center of the city.

loans.use: to purchase flower, salt, sugar, and other basic items that are needed to make bread and ice cream.

loans.name: Kachere Group

texts.en: Shamimu is 32 years old and married to a farmer; together they have six children who go to school. They also look after other relatives. She runs a market stall selling dry fish, and is applying this loan to buy fish in bulk, to reach more households in her village. Shamimu plans to expand her business and hire someone to assist in daily operations. Since she started receiving loans, she is able to make more profits and has managed to buy cement and bricks to start building a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Bethsaida Group

texts.fr: La cliente FAILA est présidente du groupe BETHSAIDA. Agée de 48ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants tous étudiants.Elle s’occupe de la vente de farine de manioc depuis 2003 grâce au fonds reçu de son mari. Elle vient solliciter un pret pour acheter 200kg de manioc. Son ambition est de réfectionner sa maison et payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.Elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes à revenu faible.
texts.en:
Faila is the president of Bethsaida Group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of nine children, all of whom attend school. Faila has been in the business of selling cassava flour since 2003 thanks to funds received from her husband.

Faila is seeking a loan to purchase 200kg of cassava. Her goal is to re-build her house and pay her children's school fees. Faila would like to thank Hekima for their support of low-income women.

loans.use: To purchase 200kg of cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow and sell rice.

loans.name: Alfredo Bernabé

texts.en:
Alfredo is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:

Alfredo is 29 years old, is married and father of a little girl. He describes himself as a hard-working person and very much enjoys doing mechanical repairs. Besides that, he likes to spend his free time reading and playing with his daughter.

He owns two taxis, he drives one of them from 9 am to 8 pm daily. The other one is driven by an employee of his who receives a part of the tariffs charged. Alfredo asks for this loan to invest it in his two units. He needs to make some repairs to them in order to avoid having to invest constantly throughout the year.

With the hard work he puts into his business, Alfredo aspires to buy more cars, have people to drive them and give his daughter a good standard of living.

loans.use: to make some mechanical repairs to the two taxis he owns

loans.name: Iblin

texts.en:
Iblin is 20 years old. She is a single woman with no children. She is stuying sociology at the University. She needs a loan to buy a laptop that will help her with her studies.

Iblin has a part time job cleaning buildings in the afternoons. She cleans the windows and the floors. She doesn't earn too much money, which is why she needs your help. Because she failed selling food, Iblin is now living in one room with her mother and her brothers. She doesn't have a father, but she wants to help her family

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa works in the grocery store business. She sells basic food products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm. She has worked in this business for five years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She requests the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

Rosa is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

Aisha has operated a food stall at the market on a retail basis for the past 20 years. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Aisha has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy raw food like yams, green banana fingers and cassava. Her goal and aspiration is to buy land so she can start farming.

loans.use: to buy raw food like yams, green banana fingers and cassava.

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
La señora Rosa tiene 86 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció, pero de esa relación tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 17 años el cual estudia en colegio y es como su hijo.
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora que para ganarse el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de pescado, este es un negocio que tenían junto a su esposo y que cuando el falleció ella tuvo que seguir en el mismo el cual le ha permitido salir adelante, dos veces por semana se traslada hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar el mejor pescado para luego enviarlo a la ciudad de Quito lugar donde viven sus hijos los mismos que venden este producto en esta ciudad, lleva más de 30 años, con este negocio ella sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos.  Sus sueños son  tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Calle America credit group meets every two weeks at Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, for which it is known nationally and internationally. It is where the famous straw hats are made.
Rosa is 86 years old. Her husband died several years ago, she has eight children as a result of this relationship who are now grown and independent. Her 17-year-old grandson lives with her, goes to school and is like her son. To earn a living, Rosa works selling fish. This is a business that she and her husband had together, and when he died, she had to continue with the business, which allowed her to move forward. She goes to Manta twice a week to buy the best fish. Then she sends it to Quito where her children live and they sell the product in the city. She has been in this business for more than 30 years and gets ahead through it. This loan is to buy fish. She is a founding member of the credit group and she likes it because they always help her with loans. Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Sandrah

texts.en:
Sandrah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who goes to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include food.  

For the last five years, Sandrah has been selling used clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis, moving from door-to-door to sell her clothes. She works six days a week. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Sandrah has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes to sell. Sandrah's goal and aspiration is to increase her capital base to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Фатима, 63 года, вдова, мать 4 детей, все взрослые и самостоятельные. У Фатимы среднее образование, с 2000 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 15 овец, 1 жеребенок, а также 1,0 ГА арендованной и 3,0 ГА собственной поливной земли, где она выращивает фасоль. Она известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность Фатимы приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Фатимы, так как сельское хозяйство - единственный источник дохода для Фатимы, она для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку 10 овец, часть средств направит на полеводство. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Fatima is 63, a widow, and the mother of four adult children who live independently. Fatima has a secondary education and has been farming as her main source of income since 2000. She has a cow, 15 sheep, a foal, 1.0 hectares of leased land and 3.0 hectares of her own irrigated land where she grows beans. She is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable person. She currently earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which is not nearly enough for a decent life. Because farming is her only source of income, she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to purchase ten sheep and use some of the funds for crops. She plans to use the profits she earns to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep and cultivate the land in order to help bolster her income

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva es una mujer de 49 años de edad, madre de nada más y nada menos que 6 hijos, su negocio consta de una confección de línea propia con la que ha podido solventar sus necesidades más básicas y aunque sabe que no tiene muchas cosas, que su casa es hecha en madera, muy humilde es feliz.
Minerva solicita un crédito para comprar telas en grandes cantidades y su más preciado sueño es construir su casa en material.
texts.en:
Minerva is a 49 year old woman and the mother to exactly 6 children. Her business is dress making, and with this she has been able to cover her most basic needs. Even though she knows that she doesn’t have many things, that her house is made out of wood, very modestly she is happy.

Minerva is requesting a loan to buy fabric in bulk. Her greatest dream is to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk to create new clothes designs for ladies and gentlemen

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace 7 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante en los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and child. For the past seven years, she has managed a small store that is located at her place of residence. She has many customers because of the quality of the products that she sells and the good prices. With her sales, Maria is able to stay ahead of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products. As a result, Maria will be able to generate better earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
La socia Rene se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rene has a grocery store where she sells such staples as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Rene has had her business for 8 years and it is going well for her.

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business and she is asking for a loan so she can buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina  se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de est negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina works in the grocery store and restaurant business. She sells basic food products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. Through this business she wants to get ahead. Bernardina is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She requests the credit to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Qolquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita, la socia tiene 48 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abono entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales menores, tienda de abarrotes, transporte, agricultura.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “VIRGEN ASUNTA.” It is located in the Qolquepata district, belonging to the Paucartambo province and Cusco department. 

The member is Margarita. She is 48 years old, has four children, and is married. She alternates her daily activities. With the business of raising small animals, she raises these small animals to later sell them to her customers. At the same time, the member works in agriculture. She feels very grateful for the granted loan and promises to fulfill the established payments. She hopes to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family. 

Margarita requests the loan to buy seeds and manure, among other things. 

The other members work in raising small animals, grocery sales, transportation, and agriculture. The member who appears in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure, among other things.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
Мутабар проживает в городке Турсунзаде. Ей 54 года, она мать четверых детей. Ее двое старших сыновей уже женаты, а один из них с женой сейчас находятся за границей. Ее вторая невестка занимается шитьем женской одежды. У Мутабара была мечта научиться мастерству кройки и шитья женской одежды, чтобы начать новую деятельность и зарабатывать на жизнь. Благодаря невестке она научилась этому ремеслу и теперь хотела бы начать свое швейное дело. Однако чтобы начать дело ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку. Из-за нехватки денег Мутабар обратилась за кредитом, за счет которого собирается приобрести электронную швейную машинку модели Yamata, а также другие необходимые швейные принадлежности. 
С помощью кредита она будет иметь работу и постоянный доход, что позволит улучшить финансовое положение их большой семьи. Только Вы можете поддержать Мутабар и она надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
Mutabar lives in the small city of Tursunzoda.  She is 54 years old and the mother of four children.  Her two oldest sons are already married: one of them is currently abroad with his wife.  Mutabar's second daughter-in-law sews women's clothes.  Mutabar has long dreamed about learning how to design and sew women's clothes in order to start a new activity and make a living.  Thanks to her daughter-in-law, she learned this craft and would now like to start her own sewing business.  However, before she can start, she needs to buy a new sewing machine.  Because she doesn't have enough money, Mutabar has requested a loan which will allow her to buy a Yamata electronic sewing machine, as well as other necessary sewing materials.

Thanks to this loan, Mutabar will have a job and a stable income, which will help her to improve the financial situation of her large family.  Will you please support Mutabar?  She is relying on you.

loans.use: to buy a Yamata electronic sewing machine and other necessary sewing materials.

loans.name: Las Gardeñas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS GARDEÑAS, él banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Benita tiene 31 años de edad  y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Las Gardeñas. The bank is located in the Kosñipata district of the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department.

The member, Benita, is 31 years old and is in a domestic partnership. She alternates her daily activities making a living cultivating fruits like oranges, bananas, and others. She spends a lot of time working in this business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it everyday. She wants to continue with this work so as to be able to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting the loan to buy seeds and compost fertilizer. She is grateful for the loan offered and commits to making the established payments.

The other members make their livings in agriculture and the breeding barnyard animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost fertilizer.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza De Honorato Vásquez  (Santa Ana) Group

texts.es:
En la parroquia Honorato Vásquez del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza de Honorato Vásquez. Ellos decidieron unirse para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la institución y con los créditos ayudarse a salir adelante.
Una de las socias de3 este grupo es la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes. 
Doña María es terapeuta de profesión y trabaja de forma independiente en su casa hasta donde llegan sus pacientes cuando requieren de sus servicios, ella además de esto también se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y calzado, la mayor parte de sus clientes son sus pacientes a quienes les vende sus productos que son muy buenos para su salud, ella también sale a recorrer por la localidad ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le compran, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva  más de 18 años dedicada a esta actividad  con  el cual se gana la vida sin depender de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar productos naturales y calzado de todo tipo. Este es su primer ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus metas seguir mejorando con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
In the Honorato Vásquez parish in the canton of Santa Ana, a place known for its beautiful freshwater pools which are a great tourist attraction of the canton and province, the loan group Nueva Esperanza de Honorato Vásquez meets every 15 days. This group decided to get together in order to access the benefits offered by the institution, and to help themselves get ahead through the loans.

One of the members of this group is Maria, who is 50 years old, divorced and the mother of three children all of whom are grown and independent. Maria is a therapist by profession and she works independently from her home, where patients come when they need her services. In addition to this, Maria also sells natural products and footwear. Most of her clients are also her patients, to whom she sells products which are good for their health. She also goes out around her neighborhood and has good customers who always buy from her. She allows them to buy on credit and she collects payments every weekend. 

Maria has been in this business for more than 18 years, and through it she earns a living without depending on her children. She will use this loan to purchase natural products and footwear of all types. This is her first cycle with the loan group, and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her goal is to continue improving with the passage of time.

loans.use: to purchase natural products and footwear.

loans.name: Yupancca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “YUPANCCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa Maria ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank "Yupancca." This bank is located in the Vilcabamba district, which belongs to the La Convención province of the department of Cusco.

The featured borrower is Rosa Maria. She is married and 62 years old; she has 4 children. She makes her living in the livestock business, fattening and raising cattle, and later selling them at various markets. She works from 8am until 6pm.

This business is how she wants to succeed in life. Her dream is to grow her livestock sales business. She is requesting the loan to purchase livestock.

The other borrowers make their living by selling animals, raising livestock, running a grocery store, and farming.

This borrower is thankful to those who are part of her dream through this program, and she commits to paying back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Las Amazonas De Atalaya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS AMAZONAS DE ATALAYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina ella es conviviente y tiene 59 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz,papa y trigo, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank "Las Amazonas de Atalaya." This bank is located in the Kosñipata district, which belongs to the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco.

The featured borrower is Sabina. She lives with her partner; she is 59 years old and has 5 children. She makes her living in agriculture. She has land where she grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. She works from 6am until 5pm.

She has been in the business for many years already, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to enlarge the area of land that she cultivates. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

The other members work in animal sales, animal breeding, and agriculture, or own a grocery store.

Sabina is thankful to those who are part of her dream through this program, and she commits to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”, esta ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, provincia de Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Dianet ella es conviviente y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos lacteos,la socia vende queso y leche,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y que terminen sus estudios, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local para la venta de queso y leche. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar queso y leche.

El socio que está pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de queso, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de cereales.
texts.en:
The "Wiñay Kury" community bank is located in the Quiquijana district in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco department. One of the members is 44-year old Sra. Dianet. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children. She earns her living selling dairy products such as cheese and milk. Through her business Dianet wishes to help her children get ahead and complete their education. She works from 8 am to 6 pm and has had her business for several years. It is doing well.

Dianet’s dream is to have a stall selling cheese and milk. She is seeking a loan to buy more cheese and milk.

She can be seen in the photo attached to the group photo. The photo was taken after the meeting which Dianet was allowed to miss as she had work commitments. The other members have businesses selling clothing, selling cheese, a grocery store and a business selling cereals.

loans.use: buy cheese and milk.

loans.name: Divino Jesus Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DIVINO JESUS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly ella es conviviente y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Jesus is located in the district of Echarate, in the province of La Convención, Cucso.

This member is called Nelly. She is 42 years old, has 2 children, and lives with her partner. She has a business cultivating fruit, and she has a field in which she grows plantain, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6am until 5pm. Nelly has run her business for many years and she is doing very well. Her dream is to enlarge the area that she farms. She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilisers. 

The other members of the communal bank make their livings selling animals, clothes, food, and running grocery stores. 

Nelly is grateful to those who want to help her realise her dream. She promises to make the loan repayments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: Alcida

texts.es:
La socia Alcida  es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca.
La socia tiene 34 años edad y  es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de hotel ,la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas entre otros.
La socia se siente  agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Alcida, is part of the communal bank “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca.” 

She is 34 years old and separated. Alcida alternates her daily activities with her hotel business. She has been working in her business for a long time, which has gone well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family. 

Alcida requests this loan to buy sheets, among other things. 

She feels grateful for the granted loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: to buy sheets, among other things.

loans.name: Senaida

texts.es:
La socia Senaida es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca.
La socia tiene 21 años edad tiene 01 hijo y  es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias al negocio de venta de cereales  como trigo, quinua, maíz entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de quinua al por mayor.
La socia se siente  agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Senaida is a member of the Nueva Visión de Rumichaca community bank. She is 21 years old, has a son, and lives with her partner. As well as her daily household chores, Senaida sells cereals such as wheat, quinoa, maize etc. She’s had her business for a while now and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She wishes to continue with this work so she can help her family.

Senaida is seeking a loan to buy quinoa at wholesale prices. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: buy quinoa at wholesale prices

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quiquijana perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis

La socia es la Sra. Augusta ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años, el sueño de la socia es tener otra tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar,galletas, leche y galletas.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal Villa Quiquijana.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Villa Quiquijana." This bank is located in the Quiquijana district, which belongs to the Quispicanchis province.

The featured member is Augusta. She's married and is 48 years old with three children. She works in her grocery store business, selling staple goods like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. 

Through this small business, she wants to get ahead. She's been doing this for several years, and her goal is to have another grocery store. She's seeking the loan to buy rice, sugar, cookies and milk.

The person in the photo with the covered face is not a member of the Villa Quiquijana community bank. The other members earn their livings through selling animals, selling grains, grocery stores and restaurants.

The members thank those who are part of this dream by this means and promise to comply with the payment of their fees by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cookies and milk.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia Benedicta es integrante del banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LA VARA”
La socia tiene 49  años edad tiene 04 hijos  y  es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lecxhe, gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente  agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a member of the Señor de la Vara Community Bank. She is 49 years old, and as well as her daily household chores she runs a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, milk etc. to her customers. She’s had her business for a while now and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She wishes to continue with this work so she can help her family.

Benedicta is seeking a loan to buy milk, soft drinks etc. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: buy milk, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Jakeline

texts.es:
