EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores y el menor de  y 17  años de edad, tres aun viven en su casa, el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil. 
Doña Mercedes es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana sobre todo en las mañanas ya que a estas horas se le hace más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lleva más de 14 años con este negocio el cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 14 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
The Calle America communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi neighborhood, known for its rich pre colonial culture and crafts, which are recognized on a national and international level. This is the place of the famous Panama straw hats. This is where Mercedes lives. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 children from this relationship. Three are adults and the youngest is 17 years old. Three still live in her home and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a mason. 

Mercedes is a homemaker who earns a living selling all types of clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories) to obtain her own income and with this, to help her husband with the household costs. She works three days a week, mostly in the mornings since it is easier at that time to make her rounds. She leaves her products on credit and collects every 15 days. She has been in this business for more than 14 years. She started it with the first loan she received from this institution.

This loan is to buy all types of clothing, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been with the communal bank for more than 14 years. She likes it because she started her business with her first loan. Her dream is to own a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  18, 14 y 7 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que  junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de caramelos al por mayor, trabajan todos los días, ellos se desplazan hasta la distribuidora de Confiteca donde comprar los caramelos al por mayor y luego se dedican a recorrer las tiendas de su localidad entregando estos productos, en cuanto a la ropa venden puerta a puerta y la compran en la ciudad de Guayaquil cada vez que necesitan, llevan más de 10 años dedicados a este negocio y es así como ellos han podido salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo van a utilizar en comprar ropa de todo tipo y caramelos para seguir con su negocio. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un carro para realizara sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The "Calle America" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are renowned both nationally and internationally. It is the place where the famous "toquilla" straw hats (more commonly known as Panama hats) come from.

In this place lives Rosa. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three children—aged 18, 14 and 7. The two oldest go to high school and the youngest goes to elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

Rosa is a very hard-working woman. She, along with her husband, makes a living selling all kinds of clothes and candy wholesale. They work every day. They go to the Confiteca distributor (a company that produces and supplies confectionary products), where they buy candy wholesale, and then visit their local stores, delivering those products. They sell the clothes from door to door and buy them in the city of Guayaquil whenever they need to. They have been running this business for over 10 years, and this is how they have been able to get ahead.

They will use this loan to purchase all kinds of clothes and candy to stay in business.

She has been a member of the communal bank since its inception, and she likes it because of the help that she gets with the loans. 

Her dream is to have a car to do her rounds.

loans.use: to buy clothes and candy.

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат, 57 лет, вдова, есть взрослый сын, образование у Шарапат среднее. Уже 25 лет она ведет свое хозяйство. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы. На участке мерою 1,01 Га она выращивает картофель и кукурузу, также саженцы для продажи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Шарапат, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства за счет покупки коровы. Доходы от бизнеса Шарапат планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и увеличение доходов ее семьи.
texts.en: Sharapat is 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of an adult son.  She has a secondary education and she has been running her own farming business for 25 years already.  She currently owns three cows.  She also grows potatoes and corn on 1.01 hectare of land, as well as seedlings for resale.  She makes a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for a decent living.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJCS for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS).  This loan will help her to buy a cow and further grow her business.  Sharapat is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals, in order to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy one cow for fattening and resale in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Las Puntualitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PUNTUALITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elba la socia tiene 32 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  con su  negocio de cultivo de frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y bono.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de animales, agricultura.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank "Las Puntualitas." This bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which belongs to the La Convención province in the Cusco department.

The featured borrower is Elba. She is 32 years old and single; she has one son. She mixes her business of raising fruits into her daily routine. She sells oranges, bananas, and other fruits to all the customers that make requests to her.

She is thankful for the loan provided to her, and she commits to paying back the loan on the established timeline. She wants to be able to continue working in this business, so that she can continue to support her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

The other borrowers make their living in fruit sales, animal sales, and agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Campanayoq De Huaran Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMPANAYOQ DE HUARAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clara Luz ella es soltera y tiene 35 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Campanayoq de Huaran”. This bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Calca, and the region of Cusco.
The member is Clara Luz, she is single and 35 years old. She works in her business selling grains, she sells wheat, maize, and quinoa. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for 4 years, and it is going well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her grains. She is asking for the loan to purchase wheat, maize, and quinoa. 
The other members work in animal sales, grain sales, grocery stores, and selling food. 
The member thanks all who form a part of this dream and is committed to meeting her payments at the established time.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, maize, and quinoa.

loans.name: Yacmel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEII, el socio tiene 01 hijo es casado, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando para una empresa publica en el ares de administración socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “COMUZONEII.” He has one child and is married. The member alternates his daily activities working for a public company in the field of administration. He has been with this job for a long time, which goes well thanks to the effort he puts in each day to his work. The member wants to be able to continue working so in this way he can continue supporting his family. 

The member requests the loan to buy a laptop. 

He feels grateful for the loan and promises to fulfill the established payments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es de la ciudad de San Igncacio, esta estudiando la Licenciatura en Radiología, está en el 4to semestre, esforzandose siempre por pdoer sobresalir en su carrera. 
Comenta que su meta es poder recibirse y encontrar un trabajo digno para poder realizarse como profesional y a la vez poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Amalia is from the city of San Ignacio, and she is studying for a degree in Radiology.  She's in her 4th semester, and is working hard to succeed in her degree program.

Amalia comments that her goal is to be able to find a decent job so that she can become a professional and also help her family.  She is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her educational expenses

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 23 años, esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y crecer.
Ella sueña con poder tener un buen trabajo para poder ayudar a sobrellevar los gastos del día a día y dar a su familia lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is 23 years old and is studying for a degree in accounting.  She is from the city of San Ignacio, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Maria dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and give her family the things that she was not able to have.  

Maria is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella se esfuerza para poder crecer, estudiar y ser alguien en la vida. Sus padres la ayudan en su lucha de estudiante.
Su meta es culminar su carrera y llegar a ser una contadora auditora y poder ayudar a su familia para retribuirles todos los esfuerzos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas,  y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Fatima is from the city of Villarrica, and she is working hard to grow, study, and become someone in life.  Her parents are helping her with her education.  Fatima's goal is to finish her degree and become an auditing accountant so that she can help her family and repay them for their efforts.  She is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en: From the Island of Siquijor, Melania earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business, with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she has applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. She hopes to live comfortably, and that her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent.  She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and to increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and to be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEII, el socio tiene 02 hijos y  es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como operador de maquinas, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank COMUZONEII. He has two children and a common law spouse. He holds his daily activities by working as a machine operator. He has had this job for a long time thanks to his dedication. He wants to continue working in this manner, to continue supporting his family. He is asking for a loan to purchase a home appliance. He is grateful for this loan and is committed to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To purchase a home appliance.

loans.name: Mirabarhan

texts.ru: Мирабархан 51 год, вдова, все дети взрослые и самостоятельные. В 1993 году, она начала бизнес по разведению скота. Мирабархан на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет 5 коров, 35 овец и 4 лошади. На участке мерою 5,0 Га она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), пенсия у Мирабархан небольшая  - 3,230 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Мирабархан развить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние ее семьи, также она планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Mirabarhan is 51 years old and a widow.  All her children are grown up and independent.  Mirabarhan started her own animal husbandry business in 1993.  She now owns five cows, 35 sheep and four horses.  On five hectares of land, she also grows clover for resale or for domestic use on the farm.  She makes a total average monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  She also receives a small pension: 3,230 som (KGS).  She is taking a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) from Bai Tushum Bank CJSC in order to buy eight sheep.  The earnings from her loan will help her to grow her business and to improve her family's welfare.  She is also planning to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep for fattening up and resale in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Mechinie

texts.en: Mechinie is managing her food vending in Siquijor. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering for added income. Recently, she was loaned an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business, and would be happier to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is from the Island of Siquijor. She is 53 years old and is married. Welma owns and operates a business buying and selling gasoline, where there is a short supply of gasoline. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Welma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Welma is requesting a loan, which will be used to purchase additional inventory of gasoline to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Angelee

texts.en: Angelee is 34 years old. She is known in the Calalinan area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house.  Therefore, she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair.  Angelee is grateful that PMPC has been her constant partner for all her financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder crecer y ser una profesional capaz de poder ayudar a los demás.
Esta estudiando la docencia en maestría, y de esa forma poder seguir incrementando sus conocimientos como lo viene haciendo, y también poder enseñar a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su estudio en docencia, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en: Rosa is from the city of Caaguazu. She is working hard to grow and become a professional able to help others. She is studying a Master's in Education so that she can continue increasing her knowledge, as she has been doing, and to teach others. She is asking for a loan to pay for her college fees, and thus be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: To pay college fees.

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Vecinas Unidas se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo, el grupo está conformado por 18 integrantes todas con actividades independientes, pero donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer.
 La señora  Ramona es una de las integrantes, ella es macatera, es decir, se dedica a las ventas ambulantes, compra productos varios y luego sale a vender, hace varios años que se dedica a esto, es por ello que ya tiene una muy buena clientela formada.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, calzados, y artículos de bazar, de manera a poder continuar con sus ventas, ya que con ello podrá seguir creciendo  luchando.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Vecinas Unidas [United Women Neighbors] is in its fourth cycle. It is made up of 18 members, all working on their own, and all putting forth their best effort in order to grow. 

Ramona is one of the members. She is a street vendor, buying various products for resale. She has been doing this for several years and now has formed a steady clientele. She is asking for this loan so she can buy clothing, shoes, and bazaar items so she can continue with her sales and her struggle to grow.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and bazaar items.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a responsible mother. She requests a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits & vegetables for retail.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Progreso” está en su ciclo 4to. del programa de comité de Mujeres Rurales, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de los 17 Señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ermelinda, quien se dedica a las confecciones de prendas, ella es muy buena en lo que hace, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Sus clientes siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, y es por ello que es muy conocida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos para la confección de prendas varias, que luego podrá vender para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The group  “El Progreso” is in its 4th cycle in the Rural Women committee program in which everyone commits to working and to helping each other get ahead. They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey in which two of the 17 women are below the poverty line, which is to say they live in extreme poverty. 

Ermelinda is one of the members who works as a seamstress making clothing. She is very good at what she does and as a result has a steady clientele. Her customers always place a lot of orders and that is why she is well-known. She is asking for this loan so she can buy fabrics and thread to make various pieces of clothing which she can then sell and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread to make clothing.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia  está en su ciclo número 5to del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para que de esa forma puedan trabajar e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes que se destaca es la Sra. Rosalina, quien se dedica a la venta variada de joyas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, da a sus clientes toda variedad de joyas, y es por eso que le va muy bien. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan y que no pasen por privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de anillos, cadenas, pulseras y demás, de manera a venderlos y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia is in its 5th cycle of the women’s communal bank program.  The members are from the city of Itá, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.  They have been working with the poverty elimination survey project, so that they can work and improve their living conditions.

One of the members that stands out is Rosalina, who makes a living selling a variety of jewelry.  She is a very hardworking and determined person.  She offers her customers a full range of jewelry and it is for that reason that it is going very well for her.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing so that she can give her family what they need and so that they don’t suffer hardships. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of rings, chains, bracelets and so on, in order to sell them and fulfill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy rings, chains, bracelets and so on to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
Ma. Riza is 42 years old, married and lives in the Island of Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in, and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan to buy additional piglets and feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to more easily keep sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and bags of feed.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is from the Island of Siquijor. She is 37 years old and is married. Arlene owns and operates snack vending business. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month doing this type of business. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities, and also avail of insurance services of the Cooperative. 

Arlene is requesting a new loan, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Jemaflor

texts.en:
Retailing helped Jemaflor’s family survive. She retails gasoline beside the street and brings in a meager income of PHP 4,000 per month. She finds the business of buying and selling gasoline easy and simple, because all she needs to do is to place the gasoline in a one liter empty bottles for her buyers. 

Jemaflor plans to expand her retailing business. She has applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of gasoline to sell. Jemaflor smiles at the thought of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal QORI SONQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 38 años de edad  y es soltero, el socio alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar transporte con su moto taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo   dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
 El socio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su moto taxi.
El socio  se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the communal bank QORI SONQO. The bank is located in the village of Calca, in the province of the same name, and in the department of Cusco. He is 38 years old and single. He combines his daily chores with his work as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has been doing this for some time and it has been going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He wishes to be able to continue with his work so he can get ahead.

At this time the member needs a loan so that he can have maintenance done on his motorcycle taxi. He is very grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to have maintenance done on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas se formo en la ciudad de Encarnación, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y por medio de el podrán conocer la situación de pobreza de cada una e ir mejorándola por medio del trabajo unido de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien se dedica a la peluquería, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que siempre ofrece muy buenos servicios a sus clientes, es por eso que es muy reconocida en su barrio. Ella quiere ir mejorando su negocio, es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder surtir su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas, tijeras y demás, de manera a seguir ofreciendo muy buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "United Women" Group was formed in the city of Encarnacion. All the members are making the effort to eliminate poverty and in that effort, they are learning the situation of poverty of each member and how it can be eliminated by means of the united efforts of them all.

One of the members is Sonia, who is dedicated to the hair care business. She wants to improve her business and, for that reason, she is requesting this loan to supply her hair salon with shampoo, hair treatments, hair coloring, creams, scissors and other supplies. Sonia wishes to continue offering her customers excellent attention and service.

loans.use: buy shampoo, hair treatments, hair coloring, creams, plus scissors and other beauty parlor supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras inician el 3er. Ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Es un grupo mujeres que desde hace más de 1 año vienen trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya, es un grupo numeroso que lucha para que sus familias no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Casilda por su parte, vende ropas, y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos, ella ve que la única forma de poder ser alguien en la vida es trabajando, es por eso que se está sacrificando cada vez mas. Su meta es poder tener cada vez mas prendas, y así ofrecer una mejor variedad a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con prendas varias, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" is starting its third loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees.  This group of women has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for a year.  It is a large group of people who are fighting so that their families are not in need.  

Casilda has a business selling clothing.  This is how she is able to help her family and loved ones.  Casilda sees that the only way to become someone in life is to work.  This is why she sacrifices herself more and more each day.  Her goal is to be able to have more garments to sell over time, so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers.

Casilda is requesting this loan to stock up with a variety of garments.  This way she can continue to make her sales, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments to sell

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este comité forman el grupo Las Emprendedoras, como su nombre lo dice, son mujeres emprendedoras, que quiern crecer y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener o a lo que no pudieron nunca acceder.
Zulma es parte de este grupo, es peluquera y pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para usar en su salón, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros productos para usar.
Ella comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo ya se hizo muy conocida y que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le piden de sus servicios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le sera de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this committee form the group Las Emprendedoras, who, as their name tells us, are entrepreneurial women, who want to grow and to give their families all the things they themselves couldn't have or that they could never have access to.

Zulma is part of this group. She is a hairdresser and is requesting this loan so she can buy supplies to use in her salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoos, rinses, and other products to use.

She comments that, thanks to her effort, she has become well-known and has many clients who always ask for her services. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoos, rinses, and other products

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, is 61 years old and a resident of Del Pilar, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three children, one of whom is in college.  She owns a "sari-sari store" (a small grocery store) that forms part of their house, and her neighbors are her clients. 

Since she has a college student to support, she has decided to improve their small business to support their children.  Therefore, she has requested a loan at Paglaum MPC in the amount of 7,000 PHP. Aside from the financial assistance, she also receives add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bernabina

texts.en:
Bernabina is 65 years old, married, and a resident of Poblacion, Sibutad, ZDN, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have five children to feed.  

Starting with capitalization of PHP 3,000, Bernabina opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last August 2013 and has taken out three loans. 

Now, Bernabina is applying for a loan to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and she will be fully-satisfied if she sees her children have a better living.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her store, particularly basic commodities.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is from Usocan, Plaridel in the Philippines. He is a widower, with seven children. 

Henry is a fisherman. He manages his own fishing business and owns fish cages, as well. He earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of his family, especially his children's education, until they graduated and got their own jobs. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase 100 liters of diesel gasoline and to pay for an engine overhaul. 

In the future, Henry hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase 100 liters of diesel gasoline and to pay for an engine overhaul.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 51-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has seven children. She industriously cares for her fishing activities. Gina personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well.  

Gina has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business, and at the same time to make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman. 

Now, Gina sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting a loan from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. She deeply wishes for a good education to her kids and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, age 43, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with two kids, and her husband is a butcher. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales.  Lorna keeps running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores.  She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  
	
Lorna has reached her fourth year being a member to Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional stock for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother, and wishes to sustain the store and from there afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for the store.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a widow and lives in Lopez Jaena, Philippines. For a living, she engages in buying and selling firewood to the local community. Apolinaria has been doing this for 15 years. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house.  Therefore, she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair. 

Apolinaria is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies. She wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is driven by the passion of selling. At the age of 64, he has chosen to live as single in Bato, Plaridel, Philipiines. He runs a store to provide for his needs. Every day he patiently tends his store until 10:00 in the evening. Alberto wants to expand his business; he recently applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where he became a member in 2011 in order to access insurance and financial assistance. 

Now he has borrowed a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his needs and to extend help to his nephews and nieces in their college education.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
In January of 2010, Lorna applied for her membership in Paglaum MPC and had her first loan. She is from Bato, Plaridel in the Philippines. Lorna is 48 years old and is married. She and her husband help each other to raise their family. They were stretching their resources to sustain the family's needs and especially to pay for the education of her children. 

Lorna came up with the idea of starting a business, since she has had the skills to make "suman" (rice cake) but she had no starting capital. She joined PMPC after hearing that she could request financial assistance. Lorna applied for a loan to start her suman-making business and it's been doing well for years. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional cooking equipment like a steamer and other raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers and able to display her suman in shops and cafes on consignment. She has also planned to use her additional revenue for her increasing orders. Lorna is thankful for the financing she gets for her capital needs. In addition, she wanted to expand and improve her business and hopes to open a house of suman near the town.

loans.use: to increase her production to provide for more customers, and able to display her "suman" (rice cake) in shops and cafes on consignment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old, married and a resident of Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. They have five children, two of whom are in college now.  Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (small grocery) store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2013 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 7,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart some day, and will be fully satisfied if she can renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is married and the family lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, and she has always been known to provide the best for them. Lilia is earning a living by making snacks that she sells on consignment in shops and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her husband, Lilia smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to increase production

loans.name: Segundo Santos

texts.es:
Segundo Santos tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 04 hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, de la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café y caña de azúcar, crianza de ganado vacuno y comercio de los mismos.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la cosecha. Con esto Segundo Santos espera mejorar la calidad del café que ofrece a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Santos is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and their four children, in their own house built from rustic materials, in the Santo Tomás district, located in the province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. The people there work mainly in agriculture, especially growing coffee and sugarcane, raising cattle, and selling them.

He works in agriculture. Specifically, he grows the Catimor variety of coffee. He also raises and sells small animals including chickens, ducks, and turkeys. He has six years of experience in the business, and has very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers to care for his coffee crop, and to hire workers for the harvest season. With these resources, Segunto Santos expects to improve the quality of the coffee he offers his clients, which will allow him to increase his income and ultimately improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to care for his coffee crop, and to hire workers for the harvest season

loans.name: Margarita Alicia

texts.en:
Margarita comes from a family of dairy farmers. She grew up in a context of increasing LP gas prices and the constant pressure of having to buy external inputs such as chemical fertilizers for the operations on the farm. She decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to free herself from these constraints, by taking advantage of a resource that is widely available to her farm: her cows' manure. 

By inputting their waste in the biodigester, the natural methanisation process will produce biogas to cook and heat water in the house, while the bacteria will produce nutrient-rich, organic fertilizer she can spread on her corn field to increase their yield in a natural way. Not only will Margarita have more income available, as she displaces LP gas and chemical fertilizers, but she will also protect the environment by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and avoiding the contamination of underground water sources by the manure. Her farm will become a cleaner and more sustainable place to live, without flies and bad smells.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, with the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ep Msaada Group

texts.fr: Monsieur MAZAMBI, président du groupe EP. MSAADA est âgée de 47 ans et père de 8 enfants tous écoliers. Il  est enseignant et marié à une femme ménagère. Il vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui permettra de réhabiliter sa maison. Il remercie HEKIMA pour avoir songé à un produit qui aidera les enseignants à modiques rémunérations.
texts.en: Mr. Mazambi, the chair of the Ep.Msaada group, is 47 years old and the father of eight children, all of whom  attend school. He is a teacher and his wife is a homemaker. He just requested a loan which will allow him to do renovations on his house. He thanks Hekima for coming up with a service which will be of help to teachers earning a modest salary.

loans.use: to do renovation works on his house.

loans.name: Chharvong

texts.en: Chharvong is an 18-year-old student and a medicine major. He is in the second year at an institution in the city and he is from Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers and his two sisters are accountants. Chharvong needs finances to pay his tuition fees from the second to the fifth year, so he would like to get a loan. With the loan, Chharvong will be able to have enough finances to pay his tuition fees for a bachelor’s degree successfully. His plans after graduation are to run a clinic to cure people, and to save money to build a house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: 01 Hạnh Phúc, Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quyết works in agriculture raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Quyết is 61 years old and she is married with three children. Quyết is the group leader of the 01 Hạnh Phúc, Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of six members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Quyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quyết has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Quyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 03, Nhuyễn Sơn, Tượng Lĩnh Group

texts.en:
Mr Kỹ works in agriculture raising poultry. He is requesting a loan as part of the Nhóm 03, Nhuyễn Sơn, Tượng Lĩnh group.

Kỹ is 57 years old and he is married with four children. He is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 03, Nhuyễn Sơn, Tượng Lĩnh solidarity group. 

In 2014, Kỹ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. Kỹ has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Kỹ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Kỹ faces in his business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Kỹ hopes to maintain a successful business, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 03Thôn Tân Chính Xã Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dự works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Dự is 62 years old and she is married with four children. Dự is the group leader of the Nhóm 03Thôn Tân Chính Xã Công Chính solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2011, Dự joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dự has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dự has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Dự faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Dự hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Leodegario

texts.en:
Leodegario is pictured here on the day his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester was installed. Investing in this technology will improve the cost-effectiveness of his farm and protect the environment, as Leodegario will be able to produce his own renewable energy and organic fertilizer from his animals' waste. 

Indeed, instead of piling his cows', sheep's and poultry's manure outside the farm, where it was contaminating underground water sources and emitting greenhouse gases, he will put it into his biodigester. His wife will be able to cook with biogas, displacing the unsustainable purchases of woodfuel and LP gas. The house will not be filled with toxic smoke any more, and the forests surrounding the farm will be protected. 

In addition, Leodegario will be able to spread the nutrient-rich biofertilizer on his plot of land, where he cultivates corn, in order to increase the yield in a natural way, eliminating the need for expensive chemical fertilizers. With the savings he makes, Leodegario plans to buy more cows to increase his milk production and be able to live from his work on the farm.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a six-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.en:
Andrés is an experienced farmer who dedicates himself to selling his cows' milk, as well as the bull calves for their meat. He also cultivates corn on a field he owns, where he produces his cows' forage. These two activities used to rely on expensive and fossil fuel based external inputs, such as LP gas and chemical fertilizers for the field. With the investment in his biodigester, he will be able to displace these inputs and replace them with the biogas and biofertilizer he will produce from his cows' waste, thus significantly reducing the operating costs and environmental contamination of his farm. He is looking forward to using the organic and nutrient-rich fertilizer on his field, in order to increase his corn's yield in a natural way. With the savings he makes, Andrés plans to buy a tractor, and even mentioned he is already interested in buying an extension of his current biodigester! Andrés is excited to bring this innovative and sustainable technology on his farm to show his children and grandchildren that fossil fuels do not necessarily have to be linked to the production of food.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is married, and she has five children, and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since in 2010, with her own working capital of USD 400, and she makes the best of it. She has a very high interest in doing business. She has a small store, but she still happy doing her business. 

She is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to improve her management for her business.  She is taking a loan of USD 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store including salt, cooking oil, noodles, candies, cigarettes and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. She also cultivates animals in her place like buffalo, cows, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy salt, cooking oil, noodles, candies, cigarettes and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 14-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: 02060202 _ Thôn Tiền Phong _ Xã Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Gái is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Gái has a retail business selling sugar, salt, cake, sweets and milk. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, salt, cake, sweets and milk to resell.

Gái is the leader of an eight-member group, the 02060202 _ Thôn tiền Phong _ Xã Hoằng Châu solidarity group. In 2000, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Gái hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cake, sweets and milk to resell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 36 años, es soltera, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Lagunas, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Maritza se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, patos y cuyes, desde hace 02 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a prestar servicios como jornalera agrícola por su zona de residencia y alrededores. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El crédito que se le otorgará lo utilizará para realizar reparaciones y mejoramiento de su vivienda, comprará material como cemento y pintura para arreglar las paredes y el piso de su casa. Esto le permitirá vivir con más comodidad y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 years old and single. She lives in her own house in the district of Lagunas, located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture and raise animals as their main economic activity.

Maritza has been working raising and selling small animals like pigs, ducks and guinea pigs for the last 2 years. She also works as an agricultural day labor in her area and the surrounding areas. She has experience in her business and has very good personal and labor references in her district.She will use the loan to make repair and improvements on her house buying materials like cement and paint to fix the floors and walls of her house. This will allow her to live with more comfort and improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to make repairs and improvements to her house buying material like cement and paint to fix the walls and floor of her house.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en la provincia de Callayuc, ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente (producto que se extrae de la caña de azúcar), cuenta con 05 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo solicitado será para la compra de materiales de destilación para implementar su negocio, así como para dar mantenimiento a sus equipos de destilación que se encuentran en mal estado. Con esto Sergio espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio y de esta manera incrementar su nivel de ventas lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is 31 years old, he lives with his partner and his young son in the province of Callayuc, located in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. The life in this community is quiet, the citizens work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. 
His occupation is the distillation of aguardiente (a liquor that is extracted from sugar cane). He has 5 years of experience in the business and has good personal and work references in the area. The requested loan is to buy distillation materials to implement in his business, and to give maintenance to his distillation equipment, which is in bad shape. This way, Sergio hopes to improve the productivity of his business and in this way increase his amount of sales, which will allow him to increase his income level and therefore be able to improve his quality of life and of his family.

loans.use: to purchase distillation materials for his business, and to give maintenance to his distillation equipment which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Unidas, ya que todas las miembros se unieron para poder dar todo de si, e ir creciendo para mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, y de esa forma conocer la situación de cada una e ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir n un nivel medio de pobreza, que va superando a través del esfuerzo y la venta variada de prendas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
La Sra. Juana  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de más prendas para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group is called Mujeres Unidas [Women united] because all the members came together to be able to give everything of themselves and keep on growing to improve their lives.  They're in the "Poverty Stoplight" program so they can find out each one's situation and improve it.

One of the members is Juana, who showed a poverty level of two in her last survey, indicating an average poverty level that she's improving by making sacrifices and by selling a variety of clothing.  She's a very hardworking and enterprising woman.

Juana's requesting this loan to buy more garments to sell.  This will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments to sell

loans.name: 02060103 _ Tiền Phong _ Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Danh is 55 years old and she is married with five children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Danh works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Danh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Danh is the group leader of the 02060103 _ Tiền Phong _ Hoằng Châu solidarity group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Danh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Adalinda

texts.es: Adalinda tiene 21 años de edad una joven con mucho ímpetu de superación en la vida y personal luchadora y muy dinámica la cual termino la primaria y en la secundaria no tuvo la misma suerte por el factor económico con sus padres. Actualmente está en una relación en unión libre su compañero de hogar se desempeña como agricultor y cultiva y siembra café, maíz y frijol. De su relación tienen actualmente un hijo el cual tiene 4 años de edad viviendo únicamente ellos en su casa de habitación. Adalinda también se dedica al igual que su conyugue al cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles lo cual aprendió por parte de sus padres quienes le enseñaron con mucho esfuerzo y esmero a realizar estas actividades. Su madre le enseño a elaborar pan y tamales para la venta en su comunidad. El terreno donde vive y tiene sus cultivos son patrimonio por parte de su esposo quien le apoya en varias actividades agrícolas y en lo económico los cuales están cerca de su casa de habitacion por lo cual el mantenimiento y demás actividades asociadas son más fáciles de dar. La socia utilizara el préstamo para invertirlo en sus cultivos de café y de esta manera mantener sus cosechas en mejores condiciones ya que su mayor objetivo es obtener cada cosecha una mejor producción por lo cual espera ser apoyada. Adalinda es una joven madre la cual es muy pensadora y tiene muchos proyectos en su vida pero principal mente uno la construcción de una pequeña vivienda con adobes, techo de zinc y piso de cemento ya que en la que actualmente es reducida y pequeña por lo cual quiere algo más grande y siempre humilde y al mismo tiempo desea aperturar una pequeña pulperia ya que tiene acceso a energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Adalinda is 21 years old. She is a youth with much drive to excel in her life. She is a fighter and a very dynamic person who finished her primary school studies but couldn't complete her secondary studies due to her parent's economic situation.

Today she is in a common-law relationship. Her life companion works in agriculture growing corn, beans and coffee. From this relationship she has a 4 year old child and the 3 of them live in their house. Adalinda also works with her spouse growing coffee beans and corn. She learned from her parents who with a lot of effort and dedication to carry out this work. Her mother taught her how to make bread and tamales to sell in the community.

The land where they live and grow is an inheritance of her husband, who supports her in the different agricultural and economic activities. They all take place close to their house so the maintenance and other activities are easy to do. The member will use the loan to invest in her coffee crops and in this way maintain her crops in prime condition as her main objective is obtain higher production with each harvest, so she hopes to be supported.

Adalinda is a young mother who thinks a lot and has many projects in her life. The main one is to build a small adobe house with a zinc roof and cement floors as the one they have now is narrow and small. so she wants something bigger but still simple. At the same time she wants to open a small store as they have electricity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay for labor to assist her coffee crops.

Maria Victoria hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeña, Olga sentía pasión por los números. Ella siempre fue calificada por sus profesores por excelente alumna de matemáticas, así que no hubo duda alguno qué carrera elegir. A sus 34 años de edad cursa todos los sábados el cuarto año de Contaduría pública y finanzas. Actualmente lleva tres meses trabajando en una empacadora de tabaco, trabajo que le ayuda a sustentar su hogar junto a su esposo, quien es comerciante, además de pagar sus estudios. 
Olga siempre ha estado inspirada por sus dos hijos de siete y nueve años de edad, quienes con entusiasmo asisten a la escuela. Por esta razón quiere seguir superándose y por lo que va a invertir en sus estudios solicitando un préstamo para pagar aranceles, su curso de titulación y su graduación. Este crédito no solo le ayudara a obtener su título como licenciada, sino también a integrarse más en el ámbito laboral. En sus planes está crear su propia empresa de consultoría.
texts.en:
From an early age, Olga loved numbers, and she was always described by her professors as an excellent mathematics student.  Thus, there was no doubt whatsoever about which career to choose.  At age 34, every Saturday she studies fourth-year Public Accounting and Finance.  She has been working in a tobacco packing plant for three months, which helps her and her husband, a businessman, to provide for their home, in addition to paying for her studies.

Olga has always been inspired by her children, ages seven and nine, who attend school with enthusiasm.  This is why she wants to excel, so she is going to invest in her studies.  She is requesting a loan to pay for registration fees, her degree course, and her graduation.  This loan will not only help her to obtain her bachelor’s degree, but also to enter into the workplace more.  One of her plans is to create her own consulting company.

loans.use: to pay for her registration fees, degree course, and graduation.

loans.name: Aaron Humberto

texts.es:
Aarón Humberto con tan solo 22 años de edad es un apasionado por las formas y estructuras. Los últimos 5 años de su vida los ha dedicado al estudio de la carrera de ingeniería civil en una institución muy privilegiada de su país. Además de ser un excelente estudiante, también  ejerce una cartera de trabajo en sus tiempo libres, esto con el propósito de independizarse y retroalimentar la  ayuda que recibe de sus padres. A causa del bajo ingreso que por ahora alberga, solicita préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil que le permita utilizar los programas necesarios para el desarrollo de su carrera.
 Aarón considera  a sus padres dos personas ejemplares, ya que estos que han impregnado la importancia de la responsabilidad y de la educación de la mejor manera en él. Cree que este préstamo será de gran ayuda al desarrollo de su educación  ya que el equipo le permitirá movilizarse con sus herramientas de trabajo a cualquier parte. Entre sus planes esta convertirse en un ingeniero innovador y apoyar al desarrollo de la infraestructura en su sociedad.
texts.en:
Aarón Humberto at only 22 years of age is passionate for forms and structure. The last 5 years of his life has been dedicated to the study of Civil Engineering in a very privileged institute in his country.

Besides being an excellent student he also has a portfolio of work in his spare time with the goal of becoming independent and to pay back some of the support he has received from his parents. Because of the low income that he now brings home he is requesting a loan to buy a laptop which will allow him to use the programs needed to develop his career.

Aarón considers his parents to be two exemplar individuals as they have imprinted in him in the best way the importance of being responsible and education. He believes that this loan will be of great help in the development of his education as the equipment will allow him to move with his work tools anywhere. Amongst his plans are to become an innovative engineer and support the development of his society's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Maria Olga tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus tres hijas en casa propia de material rústico en el Distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica al comercio y crianza de animales menores y ganado vacuno, así como a la agricultura.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en un vivero en el cual siembra diversas plantas como cedro, cipreses, entre otros, para luego venderlas, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de plantas para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Maria Olga espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de plantas a sus clientes lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Olga is 30 years old, and she is a single mother. She lives with her three daughters in her own house, which is made of rustic materials, in the district of Santo Tomás.  It is located in the Cutervo Province within the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s northern sierra.  The people there work in trade, raising small animals and cattle, and agriculture.

She works in agriculture, in a nursery where she cultivates various plants such as cedar and cypress, among others, in order to sell them later.  She has experience in the business, and very good personal and work references in the area.  

The present loan will be used for the purchase of a larger quantity of plants in order to increase her business's inventory.  With this, María Olga hopes to offer a larger variety of plants to her customers, which will allow her to improve her income level.  Thus, she will improve her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of plants in order to increase her business's inventory.

In 2014, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huyền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Huyền has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that Huyền faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Las Fronteras Group

texts.es:
Exther es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9  y 6 años y un bebe de 11 meses, y su negocio es la confección de ropa.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘el torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Exther es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela el menor es un bebé. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad (de pie a la derecha usa solera azul a rayas y sostiene billetes en la mano). Debido a la necesidad por ampliar su negocio para el bienestar de su familia, lideró una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, 
venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades.  Su trabajo es la confección de ropa, como; blusas, pijamas, pantalones, uniformes y otros, también realiza el arreglo de cuellos, largo de pantalón, cintura, etc. Sus inicios fueron como ayudante de costura, posteriormente se independizo. Actualmente vende ropa por mayor, la demanda del sector la obliga a necesitar una máquina de coser industrial para costura; “la ropa femenina tiene mucha demanda, también el arreglo de prendas, como; pantalones y blusas…” comenta. Su sueño es trabajar con ayudantes en un taller grande. Ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para satisfacer la demanda del mercado confeccionando nuevas prendas de vestir. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Exther solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar sus creaciones.
texts.en:
Exther is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has 3 children aged 11, 9, 6, and a baby of 11 months. Her business is the manufacture of clothing.

She is a good mother. She’s enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible, and hardworking. She does her work in the town of Lathe, a rural community located 45 minutes from the city by car. It is a town characterized by agricultural trade that brings together farming producers and sellers/merchants from the city. The local climate is warm, tropical, and humid with temperatures ranging between 12-35 Celsius throughout the year. 

Exther is of dark complexion with long black braided hair and short stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish when she works in trade. Her life is shared with a partner who works in construction and their children who study in school, except for the baby. They live in a rented house built of brick. They have well water and electrify. Exther is standing on the right in the blue striped tank top holding bills in her hand.

Because of her need to expand her business for the welfare of her family, she has led this group of microentrepreneurs. They sell cellular phone covers, cocoa leaves, quinoa juice, perfumes, soft drinks, skirts, ice cream and cakes. They are applying for a loan to continue these activities. Exther’s job is making clothing such as blouses, pajamas, pants, uniforms, and others. She also does repairs and takes in the necks, inseams, and waists of clothing. She began working as a sewing assistant and later became independent. She currently sells clothing wholesale and demand requires her to buy an industrial sewing machine. She says, “women’s clothing is in high demand and so is the tailoring of items such as pants and blouses.” Her dream is to work with assistants in a large workshop. She wants to buy a sewing machine of industrial quality to meet market demand by making new clothes. This is her 4th loan with the institution in the six years she has been doing this activity independently. It is for these reasons that Exther is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve her creations.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine to improve her sewing creations

loans.name: Upel

texts.ru: Упел досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его на покупку двух телят. Упел очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Упел есть 4 коровы, 10 овец и 1 лошадь. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 11,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Упел обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Упел планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Upel has repaid her loan ahead of schedule. That loan was used to buy two calves. Upel is really thankful to Kiva Microfunds and everyone who helped her with financing. At present Upel's farm includes four cows, 10 seep and one horse. Her monthly income is 11,500 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Upel has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy sheep so as to increase her livestock headcount. Upel plans to use the revenues from this loan for a further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Nhuận

texts.en:
Nhuận operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Nhuận is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Nhuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhuận has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nhuận faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nhuận hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy,

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Narbu

texts.ru: Нарбу 42 года, замужем, мать 7 детей, 4 из них школьного возраста, также с Нарбу и ее супругом живет их внук, за которым она ухаживает по его состоянию здоровья, но который по возможности помогает Нарбу по хозяйству. У Нарбу среднее образование, уже 24 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Нарбу есть корова, 12 овец и 2 лошади. На участке мерою 0,80 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль  Нарбу  составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Нарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Narbu is 42 years old and she is married with seven children, four of whom are still school-aged.  A grandson also lives with Narbu and her husband; Narbu looks after his health and he helps around the house as much as he can.  Narbu has a high school education and she has already spent 24 years raising animals and crops.  On her farm she has a cow, 12 sheep and two horses.  She grows corn for use on the farm on a .80 hectare plot of land.  Her monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS).  Narbu has turned to "Bai-Tushum" bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS), which she plans to use to buy animals to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from the loan for the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Comadres De Cotoca Group

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 14 años de edad, y su negocio es la fabricación de bijouteria.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’, que  es un área ubicado al este de la ciudad, es conocido por sus comidas típicas y su artesanía, especialmente de cerámicas.
