De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio (la primera de la derecha usa blusa verde lechuga y short blanco). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en un instituto y los menores en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio lidero una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de mandiles y lana, venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de polleras, venta de chamarras para niños, taller de soldadura, tapizado de autos y 
venta de jugos batidos, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades. Su negocio es la fabricación de bijouteria como; aretes, cadenas,  collares, manillas, pulseras,  etc. Labor que realiza durante la semana en su casa y la venta la realiza en horarios de oficina; “la artesanía del lugar se caracteriza por los materiales propios con diseños que evocan la figura de pájaros y frutas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia donde poder exponer sus artesanías. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de materia prima para trabajar, como; figuras talladas, cables de estaño, bolitas de plástico, etc., Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para trabajar sus joyas artesanales y generar mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Comadres de Cotoca Group member Virginia is 39 years old, is single, and has four children of 21, 19, 17 and 14 years of age. Her business is making jewellery.

Virginia is a good mother, enterprising, independent, responsible and hard-working. She works at her business in the Cotoca area, in the east of the city, known for its traditional foods and crafts, especially ceramics. It is a place with a warm, tropical, humid climate, with daytime temperatures between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade all year round.

In the photo, Virginia is first on the right, wearing a green top and white shorts. She has a dark complexion and long black hair, and is short in stature. Her mother tongue is Guarani, which is spoken locally, and she also speaks Spanish for reasons of general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her children; the oldest studies at the [higher education] institute and the younger ones are in school. They live together in a rented house built of brick, where they have drinking water, electricity and mains sewerage. 

Her need to grow her business led her to lead the Comadres de Cotoca group - which is made up of people with businesses including selling aprons and wool, selling alpaca sweaters, selling poultry, selling children's coats, a welding workshop, upholstering cars and selling juices - in order to seek a loan and carry on their businesses.

Virginia's own business is making jewellery such as earrings, chains, necklaces, cuffs, bracelets, etc. She does this work during the week in her home, and sells her goods during office hours. "Our local handicrafts are characterised by distinctive materials and designs that evoke birds and fruits," she comments. Her dream is to have her own shop to exhibit her handicrafts. She wishes to expand her business by buying materials to work with, such as carved figures, tin wire, plastic beads, etc. This is her third loan cycle with the lending institution, and her first year working in this business.

It is for these reasons that Virginia is seeking her share of the loan, to buy materials to make her handmade jewellery and so generate more sales.

loans.use: to buy material for her handmade jewellery and increase her sales.

loans.name: Thái

texts.en:
Thái works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thái is 43 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thái's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thái has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thái faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thái hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hình

texts.en:
Hình operates a food stall selling fish. Hình is 34 years old and she is married with two children. Hình supports three dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hình faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun, 39 years old, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three single children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 10.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is applying for a loan of $1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has two children. She is 28 years old. 

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as milk, water, biscuits, Fanta, fish, body lotion, refrigerator, oils, Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, beer and slippers. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Merlinda is living in a town near the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy. Her husband is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy milk, water, biscuits, Fanta, fish, body lotion, refrigerator, oils, Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, beer and slippers

loans.name: Octavia

texts.en:
A $1,500 loan is offered to Octavia to repair her home. She is married and has two children. She opened her building in 2005 with her own working capital of $6,000. She will use the loan to buy items like cement, sand and iron. Octavia is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.  Octavia is living in a town with her family. She has animals like pigs. Her husband is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Savorn is 21 years old and a mother of two young children. She can earn income to support her family by growing cassava and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her fifth cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has repaid her past loans completely. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Khoeun's Group

texts.en:
A villager in Kampong Cham province, Khoeun is 40 years old and a mother of two children. To make a living, she works as a rubber tree cutter and also grows cassava to earn more income.

This is Khoeun's third cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is leading a group of three to get a new loan and will spend her loan portion to buy seed to support her cassava farm. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seed to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is applying for a loan of $1,500 to repair her car. She is running a transportation by minibus business. She is making a good income from her car and she wants to fix her minibus and also buy body lotion. She is living in a town near the main road; so many people come to use her car. She opened her business in 2002 with her own.working capital. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To fix her minibus and buy body lotion

loans.name: Kimyean's Group

texts.en: An old woman living in Kampong Cham province, Kimyean is 61 years old and a mother of five children. To earn a living, she grows rice on one hectare of land as the main source of income and sells ice cream to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 38,900 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a pushcart to support her business. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family condition so it gets better than before.

loans.use: To buy a pushcart to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two schoolchildren living in Kampong Cham province, Sareth is 31 years old. To ameliorate her family’s hardships, she earns income by farming rice and working for others for a fee to earn more income.

This is Sareth's fourth cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has repaid her past loans completely. She is the leader of a group of four. She will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house. She hopes to have a decent house to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreylim's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sreylim is 29 years old. She can earn an income to support her living condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. For Sreylim, this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farming. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living so they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Lazos De Amistad Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 4 y 7 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de gelatinas y masitas típicas.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, sociable, agradable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; mineros relocalizados del occidente del país y etnias como ‘Los Ayoreos’ nativas del lugar, se establecieron. Su siguiente generación, en su mayoría se ocupa del comercio y manufactura. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Isabel es de tez morena, cabello negro largo recogido, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, usa blusa roja y pantalón negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y los menores aún se encuentran al cuidado de la madre, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su deseo de superación la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de muebles,
venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas, 
confección de polleras, servicio de transporte y tienda de videos, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de gelatinas y masitas tradicionales, como; gelatina de varios sabores en vaso plástico descartable y masitas horneados; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Zonzo (Puré de yuca mezclado con queso y formado en un palito para luego cocinarse en una parrilla o al horno), Empanada de queso frita (Masa delgada de harina de trigo rellena con queso y frita en aceite con azúcar en polvo espolvoreada encima al servir), Empanada de jigote (Masa delgada de harina de trigo rellena con mezcla de carne o pollo y verduras y frita en aceite). Labor que realiza durante el día para realizar los horneados por la noche y todos los días de la semana. “la gelatina es bastante agradable en los días cálidos que tenemos aquí y viene acompañada de alguna masita…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir un snack para vender desayunos y almuerzos, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un refrigerador y harina por quintal, para guardar los alimentos y contar con harina suficiente para realizar grandes pedidos, debido a la temporada. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador y harina por quintal para satisfacer la demanda de la época.
texts.en:
24-year-old Isabel lives with her partner. They have 3 children ages 2 ,4 and 7. Her occupation is the sale of jello and traditional pastries. 

She is entrepreneurial, independent, sociable, charming, responsible and hardworking. She developed her business in the "Plan 300" area, which is characterized by its enormous population growth. Miners who relocated from the west of the country and indigenous groups from the region, such as the Ayoreos, have been moving to the area. The most recent generations primarily work in commerce and manufacturing. The region has a warm, tropical, humid climate, with daytime temperatures varying between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.
 
Isabel is short, has olive skin and long black hair. Her mother tongue is Guarani, which is spoken in the region. She also speaks Spanish because of her education and occupation. In the photo, she is sitting in the middle, wearing a red blouse and black pants. She shares her life with her partner, who is a construction worker, and with her children. Her oldest son is in school and she still fully takes care of her other two children. They live in a rented brick home with a corrugated iron roof. They have drinking water, electricity and are connected to the sewage network. Due to her desire to get ahead, she ended up leading a community bank. The bank's members have businesses such as the sale of furniture, the sale of quilts, the manufacturing of leather bags, the sale of meat pies, dressmaking, transportation services and video stores. The purpose of the members is to obtain loans and achieve their goals. 

Isabel's business is making and selling jello and traditional pastries. Some of her products are jello of different flavors in disposable plastic cups, pastries, cuñapé (small bun make of yucca flour and cheese), rice empanadas (baked pocket filled with rice and cheese), zonzo (yucca purée mixed with cheese baked or roasted in a stick shape), fried cheese empanadas (thin wheat flour dough mixed with cheese and fried in oil served with sprinkled sugar on top), and jigote empanadas (fried thin wheat flour dough filled with a mix of beef or chicken and vegetables). 

She sells her products during the day and prepares the baking goods in the evening and on weekends. "Jello is very nice on our warm days and it comes with a pastry", she says. Her dream is to open a small restaurant to sell breakfasts and lunches. She would like to expand her business by purchasing a refrigerator and flour by the quintal, to be able to make her ingredients durable and to have enough flour for large orders (due to the season). This is the association's first loan cycle in the year that it has existed. This is why Isabel is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and flour by the quintal to satisfy the season's demand.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and flour by the quintal to meet the current demand.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is a 58-year-old married man and a father of five grown children from San Miguel, Bohol. He earns a living through his sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. Felipe has been in the business for more than six years now. Felipe is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, and cooking oil. This loan will enable him to improve his inventories, thus attracting more buyers in his store. In the future, Felipe hopes to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Yany

texts.en: Yany, 51, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Thom province and is a mother of one child. To tackle her family’s hardships, she earns an income via rice cropping and selling grocery items to earn extra income. For Yany, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to study make-up skills. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to study make-up skills.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 57 years old, married and blessed with six adult children. They are currently living in a rural community and make their living through farming. They aspire to plant more vegetables and root crops but they do not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed to grow vegetables and root crops. Through patience and hard work, she believes that they will improve their farming business and have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed to grow vegetables

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her tuition fee for her bachelor's degree majoring in finance and banking.

loans.name: Sreyot

texts.en: Sreyot, 22, lives with family members in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She is a student and does not yet work. For Sreyot, this is her first time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay her tuition fee for her bachelor's degree majoring in management. She hopes that she can get a good job after graduation so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fee for her bachelor's degree majoring in management.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sithan's Group

texts.en: Sithan, 35, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one is too young. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her living conditions via growing corn. She can earn an income of about 39,700 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farm so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Savy is 54 years old and a mother of six children. She grows rice as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. For Savy, this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of five members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her farm so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Doung's Group

texts.en: Doung, 48, is a farmer from Kampong Cham province and a mother of five children. For the sake of her family, she grows cassava on four hectares of land. Moreover, she grows cashews on two hectares to earn more income. This is the sixth loan for Doung with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Yoeung's Group

texts.en: Yoeung is 61 years old and a mother of nine children living in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows rice and rubber and works for others for a fee. Moreover, she can earn more income via growing cassava. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 35,900 KHR per day. For Yoeung, this is her second cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner; she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rubber farm. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rubber farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is a 48-year-old married grocer with three children who resides in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has been in her business since 2011. Her husband is 53 years old and he cultivates rice and fattens animals. One of her children works for a company. Together, they can make an income of USD 25 a day. To improve her family’s finances, Neang would like a loan for her husband to buy piglets to fatten and resell. She also hopes to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and resell

loans.name: Asi Es La Vida Group

texts.es:
Mariza es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 6 y 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de dulces.
Ella es sociable, agradable, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; mineros relocalizados del occidente y etnias como ‘Los Ayoreos’ nativas del lugar, se establecieron. La siguiente generación, en su mayoría se ocupa del comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Mariza es de tez morena, cabello negro largo recogido, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro, usa blusa negra pantalón jean celeste, cartera negra y sostiene un cuaderno en la mano). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con su hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y los menores aún se encuentran al cuidado de la madre, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su deseo de superación la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, venta de empanadas, servicio de construcción, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, tienda de barrio y carnicería,  para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de dulces; Los dulces artesanales que elabora son un buen complemento alimenticio, porque no sólo son el placer de degustar un sabor, sino aportan a la alimentación diaria mediante; 
un contenido de calorías adecuado, Un Sabor y color apropiado a razón de la fruta con la que está elaborada, una acidez media, una consistencia y aspecto agradable, Y un aroma agradable. “La elaboración artesanal de dulces tiene un origen relativamente reciente, primero fue muy casera, actualmente seguimos procesos y procedimientos casi industriales…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pulpería, ella desea realizar la compra de materia prima como; azúcar granulada, ácido cítrico, pectina, fruta, frasco de vidrio y de plástico para envasar y otros. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Mariza solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de dulces artesanales por mayor.
texts.en:
Mariza is a 25 year old. She lives with her partner and has three children who are 9, 6 and 3 years old. Her business is the sale of sweets. Mariza is sociable, kind, entrepreneurial, independent, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business in the "plan 3000" zone, an area characterized by its gigantic population growth. Miners who have relocated from the west and ethnic peoples like the Ayoreos, who are natives of the area, have established themselves. All around this area, the majority of the next generation works in sales and manufacturing. The climate is hot, tropical and humid, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Mariza has a tan complexion, long dark updone hair and is small of stature. ([In the photo] she is in the center in a black shirt and bright blue jeans with a black fannypack and holding a notebook in her hand). Her native language is Guaraní which is spoken in this area, and she speaks Spanish in everyday life and in her business. 

She share sher life with her partner who also is in sales, and with her children. The oldest is studying in school and the younger ones are still in their mother's care. They live in a rented home built of brick with a corrugated iron roof and drinkable water, electricty and a septic system. 

Her desire to get ahead motivated her to lead a communal bank of people to take out a loan and achieve their dreams. Their businesses are: neighborhood store and butcher, sewing, fish sales, empanada sales, construction services, cosmetic sales, and the sale of seasonal clothing.

Mariza is in the business of making and selling candy. The artisan candy she prepares are also of good nutritional value because not only do her candies taste enjoyable; they also provide daily nutrition through the adequate amount of calories, the flavor and color of the fruit from which they are made, mild acidity, and pleasant consistency, appearance and smell. Mariza says "the preparation of artisan candies has a relatively recent origin. At first they were very amateur, but now we follow processes and procedures that are almost industrial".

This is the fourth series of loans with this institution in the two years since she has been running this business independently. Mariza's dream is to have a small store. For these reasons Mariza requests a loan to purchase materials to prepare her artisan sweets in bulk. She would like to purchase raw materials such as: granulated sugar, citric acid, pectin, fruit, glass jars and plastic wrap, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make artisan candy in bulk.

loans.name: Chhunny's Group

texts.en: Chhunny, 48, is a mother of five dependent children living in Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she grows rice as her main source of income and weaves cotton scarves to earn more income. For Chhunny, this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the labor fees to support her farming and buy more silk. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay the labor fees to support her farming and buy more silk.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en: Noeurn, a local resident from Kampong Cham province, is 58 years old and a mother of six children. She does rice cropping on one hectare of land as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via fish selling. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get a bigger yield than she did before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Savoern

texts.en: A villager living in Kampong Cham province, Savoern is 44 years old and a mother of three children. Nowadays, she earns an income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her first time for Savoern with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a cow to plow her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Koeun's Group

texts.en: Koeun, 45, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and is a mother of eight children. For her living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 38,900 KHR per day. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a cow to support her farming. She hopes that she can get greater yields than she did last year.

loans.use: To buy a cow to support her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chhun's Group

texts.en: Chhun, 41, lives with family members in a rural area in Kampong Cham province. She is a tailor and she works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 38,900 KHR per day. For Chhun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy more cloth to support her business. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's conditions so they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to transport her rice.

loans.name: Nhóm 7-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, pictured first from the right, is 28 years old. She works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 450,000. She is married with 2 small children. 

She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2007. Currently, her household does not have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, she will use the funds to build a hygienic toilet.  

This will improve the living conditions for her family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine.

loans.name: Gulbarkan

texts.ru: Гулбаркан 44 года, замужем, 2 детей. У Гулбаркан высшее образование, она работает в библиотеке, также занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулбаркан есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, 4 лошади, также на 1,28 ГА поливной земли, она выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Гулбаркан составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Она очень любит свое дело и хочет развить его, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулбаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса, а в будущем она мечтает отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Gulbarkan is 44, married, and has two children.  She has a university education and works in a library.  She also works as a crop and livestock farmer.  She currently has two cows, ten sheep and four horses on her farm as well as 1.28 hectares of irrigated land.  She grows barley both for use on her own farm and as a cash crop.  

Gulbarkan's monthly gross income is around 10,000 som.  She loves what she does very much, and wants to develop her business.  For this reason, she's requested a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock for fattening and resale.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to continue expanding her business in the future, and also dreams of eventually renovating her home.

loans.use: buy additional livestock to invest in her business

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijas de 12, 10, 7 años y una bebe de 2 meses, y su negocio es la venta de verduras.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, responsable, optimista y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un puesto fijo de venta en un mercado conocido de la zona central, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, como; universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura variable entre 4-21 grados centígrados durante el día y en todo el año.
Delia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, sostiene a un bebe en los brazos y usa suéter negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y sus 4 hijas; las 3 mayores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia de la familia, construida de adobe y ladrillo, y cuenta con el servicio de electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. La necesidades de satisfacer los gastos familiares la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; tapizado de autos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades.  Su negocio es la venta de verduras, como; zanahorias, lechugas, brócoli, tomates, pimentón, etc., negocio que heredó de su madre y se dedica a esta actividad desde que tiene uso de razón. “las verduras varían de precio según la temporada y la calidad, pueden ser de carpa o de campo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una camioneta para transportarse desde su casa a su trabajo cargado de cajas de vegetales. Ella desea realizar la compra de verduras por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
Es por esos motivos que Delia solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de verdura por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Delia is 33 years old and lives with her partner and four daughters, ages twelve, ten and seven years old, and two months old. Delia has a business selling vegetables. Delia is a good mother. She is plucky, responsible, optimistic and hard-working. Her business is located at a fixed stall in a well-known market in the centre. The area has a lot of trade there, with public offices, private businesses and universities operating side by side. The climate here is cold and dry, with the daily temperature oscillating between 4 and 21º degrees all year round.

Delia has dark skin, is short, and has long, pleated black hair. She wears traditional clothes (a hat, blanket and top). Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, but she also speaks Spanish outside and at work. In the photo, Delia is in the front row; first on the right she is holding a baby). 

Delia shares her life with her partner, a builder, and her four daughters. Her eldest three daughters are in school. The family owns the house where they live. It is built with adobe and bricks, and has electricity, running water and is connected to the sewer system. 

With a need to cover household costs, Delia decided to lead a communal bank of people with different businesses including: upholstering vehicles, selling fruit juices, mobile phone covers, coca leaves, quinoa juice, perfumes, soft drinks, sweatshirts, ice cream, and preparing savoury pastries (or "empanadas"). The group has come together in order to apply for a loan and expand their businesses.

Delia herself has a business selling vegetables, such as carrots, lettuce, broccoli, tomatoes, peppers and more. She inherited this business from her mother and has been working there for as long as she can remember.

Delia says, "The price of vegetables varies according to the season and their quality, whether they are sold outdoors or at a tent sale."

Delia's dream is to own a small van to transport her products from her home to her stall. Delia wants to buy a variety of vegetables in bulk to satisfy season demand.

For these reasons, Delia is applying for a loan in order to buy a variety of vegetables in bulk to satisfy season demand.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables in bulk to satisfy season demand.

loans.name: Lidia Alexandra

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Lidia tiene una pequeña fábrica de botones, con la ayuda de los créditos compro lo necesario para poder comenzar su negocio y en la actualidad ya cuenta con dos maquinas que sirven para elaborar estos productos, todas las semanas ella entrega a comerciantes que luego los venden a exportadores en la ciudad de Manta para que los lleven a otros países y les den el terminado a los botones. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ayuda de una hermana a quien le paga un sueldo mensual. Lleva cuatro años con su negocio y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar tagua y otros mariales para elaborar los botones. Lleva más de 9  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y por los servicios que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener una empresa mucho más grande.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as the straw hats known both in the country and abroad, the members of the 4 De Noviembre communal bank meet every fortnight.

Lidia lives here. She is 36 years old and married with three children, who are 13, 11 and 5 years old. The oldest studies in high school and the younger ones in primary school. Her husband is a merchant.

Lidia has a small button factory. With the help of previous loans, she bought what was necessary to be able to start her business, and currently she has two machines that create these products. Every week, she turns over her buttons to merchants who then sell them to exporters in the city of Manta, who then bring these buttons to other countries to finish. She works from Monday to Saturday with the help of her sister, who she pays a monthly salary. She has worked in this business for four years, and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy tagua palm and other materials to make the buttons. She has been with the communal bank for more than nine years and she likes it for the help and services that the institution offers them.

Her dream is to have a much bigger company.

loans.use: to buy tagua palm and other materials to produce buttons.

loans.name: Pedro Gonzalo

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito  La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
En este lugar vive don Pedro, tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 18, 16, 14, 13, 10 y 8 años  de edad, los dos menores estudian en escuela. Su mujer trabaja en un torno.
El señor Pedro es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir, el es albañil y  trabaja por contratos de personas particulares que le piden que les construya sus casas o cualquier tipo de trabajos relacionados con su profesión, el necesita de varias herramientas para realizar una mejor labor razón para lo cual requiere del crédito ya que es así como el se gana el sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar una maquina cortadora de hierro y otras herramientas que necesita. Lleva dos ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank La Dolorosa Del Pechiche meet once a fortnight in the Los Bajos neighbourhood in Montecristi, a city renowned for its great diversity of locally-made products, such as Panama hats which are well-known both within the country and abroad. This area is home to 39 year old Pedro, who is married with 6 children aged 18, 16, 14, 13, 10 and 8 years. His 2 youngest children still attend school and his wife works as a lathe operator. Pedro works hard and does whatever he can to provide for his family's needs. He works as a builder, taking on contractual work from people who hire him to build their houses or accepting any other type of building work. He needs to be in possession of various tools in order to improve the work that he carries out and, for this reason, he is applying for this loan so that he can earn his daily crust.
The loan will be used to buy an iron cutting machine and other necessary tools. This will be his second loan cycle with the communal bank and he likes this arrangement as the loans are a great help. His greatest aim is to provide the best that he can for his family.

loans.use: to buy an iron cutting machine and other tools

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is a 50-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She engages in a vending business. She sells snack foods like home-made rice cakes, spaghetti, boiled ripe bananas,  and many others. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are still attending school.
 
She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, leavening agent, spaghetti sauce, meat and sauce. These ingredients will be used in preparing more snacks which will be sold to the nearby communities. In the long run, she will be able to manage her finances and start paying her obligations. She can now continue sending her children to school.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, leavening agent, spaghetti sauce, meat and sauce.

loans.name: Elvita Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
En este lugar4 vive la señora Elvita, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Elvita para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, cuando ellos pueden, pero por lo general es ellas la que mas pasa en su negocio. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el beneficio de su familia.
 Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace más de 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its wide variety of traditional products, such as the paja toquilla hats, known in and out of the country, the La Dolorosa Del Pechiche credit group meets every two weeks. This is where Elvita lives. She is 49 years old, married and from the relationship has four grown children. One of them still lives with her. Her husband works in agriculture.

In order to get ahead, Elvita and her family have a convenience store in their house. She sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, pulses, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., sometimes later. Her son and her husband help her at work when they can, but generally she is the one who spends the most time at the business. She has done this activity for five years and with it she earns her income to benefit her family.

This loan is for buying supplies to stock her store up more. She has been in the Credit Group for over five years and she likes it for the help with the loans. Her goal is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Leidy Patricia

texts.es:
Leidy, de 24 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.
Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de sus 2 hijos.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía como ropa y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Leidy is 24 years old. What she wants for her life is very clear for her and she has decided to get ahead and have a good life. 

She works selling various merchandise such as clothing, accessories, such as wallets, some cosmetics, and more. She started this activity in order to seek resources she needed to support herself and her 2 children. 

She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman. She is asking for the loan to buy a wide variety of merchandise such as clothing. This way, she will have inventory available to sell to her customers. 

She hopes to be able to progress as a businesswoman and have more stable income.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blue jeans, blouses, t-shirts and coats.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge está estudiando la carrera de agronomía que está culminando gracias al esfuerzo de  ella y de sus padres.
Comenta que después de terminar su carrera quiere trabajar y recuperar todo el esfuerzo y la que hicieron por ella sus padres. Su meta es terminar su carrera y luego estudiar alguna especialización.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de tesis, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Jorge is studying agronomy and he is nearing completion thanks to his and his parents' efforts. He says that after finishing his major he wants to work and pay back all of the work his parents did for it. His goal is to finish his major and then study in some type of specialization. 

He is asking for a loan to be able to pay for expenses related to his thesis, so that he can cover that expense that he has.

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to his thesis.

loans.name: Faber

texts.es:
Faber, con 35 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Norcasia; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

Faber manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Faber is 35 years old. For several years, he has worked selling groceries in a store in the town of Norcasia. In this way, he adds to the income that he gets his children ahead with. 

His tenacity and perseverance has allowed him to fight tirelessly, always seeking a way to get ahead. This is what is driving him to ask for the loan to buy a variety of snacks, sodas, candies, baked goods, and more wholesale. This will allow him to continue with his work and have a wider variety of items to offer his customers, thus improving his sales and income.

Faber says that his his biggest wish to to be able to acquire a locale in the center of town to set up his business and make it much more profitable. This will guarantee a favorable financial stability to offer his family a better quality of life. 

He has confidence in the support from Corporación Interactuar and the Kiva lenders to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy a variety of snacks, sodas, candies, and baked goods wholesale to continue consolidating and maintaining his business.

loans.name: Manuela Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito  La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
Aquí vive la señora Manuela, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad y aun vive con ella.  
Doña Manuela en sociedad con su hijo tienen una fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), allí su hijo junto con dos ayudantes a quienes se les paga un sueldo semanal  se encargan de fabricar los ladrillos para luego ellos mismos entregarlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta el sitio para luego llevarlos a los puntos de venta al por menor o directamente a las construcciones donde necesitan de este material muy utilizado en toda la provincia, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y esto lo vienen realizando desde hace mas de 15 años actividad que les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín y palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar estos productos. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque la han ayudado mucho con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its wide diversity of typical products, such as the brimmed straw 'Panama' hats famous both in and out of the country, the members of the La Dolorosa Del Pechiche Credit Group meet every two weeks. This is where Manuela lives. She is 56 years old, a single mother with a grown-up son who still lives with her.

In partnership with her son, Manuela owns a brick factory (material used to build homes), where her son, along with two assistants who are paid weekly wages, manufactures bricks. They supply the bricks to tradesmen who come to the site and transport them to retail outlets or directly to construction sites where this material is widely used throughout the province. They work from Monday to Saturday from 8a.m. to 4p.m. They have been doing this work for over 15 years now and it is an activity that enables them to get ahead. 

This loan is to buy firewood, sawdust and palm fibers, which are the materials used to make these products. Manuela has been in the Credit Group for 8 years and she likes it because they have helped a lot with the loans. Her dream is to carry on getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sawdust and palm fibers.

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es:
Kelly de 26 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 
Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 
Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.
Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 
Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Kelly is 26 years old and is regarded with great affection by her neighbours as she is a pleasant individual with a good sense of humour. She loves her family and they are her greatest motivation to struggle on each day and to generate the sustenance required for their survival. Although she began her business with few resources, this did not prohibit her from fulfilling her dream of becoming a businesswoman so with the little money that she did have, this lady started a grocery store business. Her dreams know no bounds and, consequently, she is now applying for a loan which she will invest in buying shelving to display her products, so increasing their visibility and making them more appealing to her customers. Additionally, she plans to buy a range of family essential food items in order to re-stock her business. She hopes that she will be able to improve her economic situation so that she can reach her old age without worrying about money and be able to guarantee a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shelving to display her products as she started her business very little capital and she has been building it up a little at a time.

loans.name: María Estefania

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 5, 4 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña María en con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su maridos a darles lo mejor a sus hijos desde hace tres años atrás con lo que tenia y con la ayuda de su marido surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí además de vender víveres también vende productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos que vende en su local y también sale a recorrer puerta a puerta los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. De esta forma ella se gana lo suyo que le sirve para salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para  surtir su tienda y productos Belcorp. Este es su tercer ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as straw hats known within the country and abroad, the members of the communal bank group 4 de Noviembre meet every two weeks. 

María lives in this place. She is 24 years old, married, and in this relationship they have three children, ages 5, 4, and 2. The two older ones go to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Three years ago, with the end of earning something on her own and, with this, helping her husband to give the best to their children, María stocked a small grocery store in her house. There, in addition to groceries, she also sells Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories), which she sells in her retail space and she also goes out to sell them door-to-door, and leaves them on credit and collects each week. In this way, she earns her own income, which helps her to get ahead.

This loan is to purchase groceries to stock her store and Belocrp products. This is her third cycle with the communal bank group and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dreams are to get ahead and give the best to her little ones.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and Belcorp products.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar 	vive la señora Johanna, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5 meses  de edad. El marido es ebanista.
Doña Johanna es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta contar con sus propios  ingresos y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella sale a recorrer tres días por semana, aprovecha que en las mañanas su mamá le cuida al bebé, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar bisutería, pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende en esta época del año. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as straw hats known within the country and abroad, the members of the communal bank group 4 de Noviembre meet every two weeks. 

Johanna lives in this place. She is 19 years old and is in a common-law marriage in which she has a 5-month-old child. Her husband is a woodworker.

Johanna is a very hard-working young woman who likes to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses. She works selling all sorts of clothing and costume jewelry. She sells door-to-door and also sells in her house where her customers come when they need an article of clothing. She goes out to make her sales three days each week and takes advantage of the fact that, in the mornings, her mother takes care of he baby. She leaves the items on credit and collects every two weeks. She has been working in this job for 1 year, which she began with the first loan that she got from the group. 

This loan will be used to purchase costume jewelry, pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing which is what she sells the most during this season. She has been in the communal bank group for 4 loan cycles and she likes it because with the loans she gets ahead. Her dream is to give the best to her baby.

loans.use: to purchase costume jewelry, pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Cerro Cora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cerro Cora  está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas las integrantes están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona rural, aun en crecimiento.
La Sra. Zunilda es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de  bocaditos salados y dulces, también hace sus bocaditos sobre pedidos, tiene muy buena clientela, ya que sus bocaditos son muy ricos y aceptados por sus clientes. Ella es muy buena en lo que hace, y quiere seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus bocaditos, como ser verduras, carne, panificados, hortalizas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called Cerro Cora is in its first loan cycle; it is a new group, where all the members are putting their best efforts into being able to improve their living conditions and that of their families. They are from the city of Curuguaty, a rural zone, still growing. 
 
Zunilda is one of the members. She works selling sweet and savory bite-sized foods, and also makes these by order. She has a very good customer base, since her foods are delicious and accepted by her customers. She is very good at what she does and wants to continue growing. 

She asks for this loan to purchase supplies to be able to continue making her foods, such as vegetables, meat, bread products, and others.

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, bread products and others to make bite-sized foods.

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de verduras.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, responsable, optimista y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Mary es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro usa blusa animal print). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con el servicio de electricidad y agua de pozo. La necesidad de satisfacer los gastos familiares la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; confección de polleras, servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores y servicio de té,para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades.  Su negocio es la venta de verduras, como; zanahorias, lechugas, brócoli, tomates, pimentón, papas, etc., negocio que heredó de su madre y se dedica a esta actividad desde que tiene uso de razón. “la venta de verduras se realiza diariamente, el clima del lugar daña las verduras rápidamente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio. Ella desea realizar la compra de verduras por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
Es por esos motivos que Mary solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de verduras por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and lives with her partner and their 12 year old son. She is a good mother: strong, determined, responsible, optimistic and hard-working. Her business operates in 'El Torno', a rural community located 45 minutes drive from the nearest city. The area is characterised by farming businesses where rural producers meet and sell their produce to city distribution buyers. The climate in this area is tropical, warm and humid, with annual temperatures during the day ranging from 21-35 degrees centigrade.
Mary is of dark complexion, with long plaited dark hair and her mother tongue is Guaraní, a language she uses in her local area whereas she speaks Spanish in other cultural contexts and for business purposes. In the photo, Mary is seated in the middle wearing an animal print t-shirt. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and their son who attends school. They live in a rented house built of bricks which provides them with electricity and a water well. The need to provide for her family's financial requirements led her to set up a communal bank so that she could apply for a loan and expand her business activities. The other group members run businesses which include clothing manufacture, transport services, video shop, crockery sales, cell phone sales, poultry meat sales, flower sales and a tea service. Mary's business involves selling vegetables, such as carrots, lettuces, broccoli, tomatoes, cayenne peppers and potatoes. She inherited this business from her mother and she has been running this business ever since she has had need for it. She tells us that, 'she sells her vegetables every day but the local climate means that the vegetables spoil quickly'. Her dream is to have her own business. She wishes to buy a large quantity of vegetables so that she can satisfy the seasonal demand, consequently, Mary is applying for a loan to buy a variety of vegetables in large quantities in order to satisfy the seasonal demand.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables in large quantities so that she can satisfy the seasonal demand.

loans.name: Frontera San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas trabajan y se esfuerzan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La señora Teresa es una de las integrantes del comité, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas en la olería que tiene, y con la cual mantiene y da a su familia lo que necesitan para un mejor día a día.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leñas y arcilla para la producción de ladrillos.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this committee have a variety of jobs, each one of them works and puts her effort into being able to improve their living conditions and that of their families. They are very hard-working and determined women.

Teresa is one of the members of the committee. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person, who works every day from the early morning hours in the brick-making factory that she has, and with which she maintains and gives her family what they need to have better days

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of firewood and clay to make bricks.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Juana Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito  La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, 6 de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y uno de 11 años, dos de ellos estudian  en  universidad y escuela y son los que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo  se dedica al comercio y  es agricultor.
Doña Juana y su marido se dedican al comercio, ellos venden frutas, verduras y legumbres, ella vende en su casa mientras que el recorre la localidad en un triciclo,  vende todos los días en su casa mientras que su marido sale tres o cuatro veces por semana, actualmente está arreglando un terreno para poder sembrar en esta época invernal, el lleva 5 años con la venta de sus productos mientras que ella un año, actividad  que les permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y verduras para  vender  a sus clientes. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos su familia ha podido salir adelante con su pequeño negocio. Sus sueños comprar un carro para ir a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its wide diversity of typical products, such as the brimmed straw 'Panama' hats that are famous both in and out of the country, the members of the 'La Dolorosa Del Pechiche' Credit Group meet every two weeks. This is where Juana lives. She is 44 years old, married and has 7 children from the relationship, 6 of whom are grown-up and one 11-year-old. Two are at school and university and still live at home with her. 

Juana's husband is a businessman and farmer. Juana and her husband run a business selling fruit, pulses and vegetables. She sells in her house while he travels around the local area on a tricycle selling the produce. She sells from home every day while her husband goes out three or four times a week. At the moment, he is preparing a plot of land to be able to sow seeds this winter season. He has been selling his produce for five years while she has been doing so for a year. It is an occupation that enables them to get ahead. 

This loan is to buy fruit, pulses and vegetables to sell to their customers. She is a founding member of the Credit Group and she likes it because the loans have enabled her family to get ahead with their small business. Her dream is to buy a vehicle to go out and sell their produce.

loans.use: to buy fruit, pulses and vegetables.

loans.name: Manuela Petita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Noviembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Manuela, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 21, 16 y 14 años de edad, todos estudian  en universidad y colegio. El marido es controlador de buses. 
Doña Manuela  es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganar lo suyo y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta artículos para el hogar tales como: licuadoras, planchas, tostadoras, sabanas, vajillas, entre otros productos, en las mañanas se dedica a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada fin de semana, pero en las tardes ella instala una mesa en las afueras de su casa y allí vende las deliciosas empanadas de verde, muchines de yuca, corviches  y gaseosas, trabaja todos los días y lleva realizando esta actividad ya por más de 5 años, ella empezó su negocio con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución.
Este crédito es para comprar planchas, licuadoras e ingredientes para elaborar los bocadillos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para poder comenzar en sus negocios. Sus sueños son ver realizados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as straw hats known within the country and abroad, the members of the communal bank group 4 de Noviembre meet every two weeks. 

Manuela lives in this place. She is 46 years old and is in a common-law marriage in which they have three children, ages 21, 16, and 14. All of them are students at university and secondary school. Her husband is a bus dispatcher.

Manuela is a woman who likes to work to make her own earnings and, with this income, help her husband with the household expenses. She works selling household products such as blenders, irons, toasters, sheets, and dishes, among other products. In the mornings she goes out through the whole locality offering her products, which she leaves on credit and collects every weekend. But in the afternoons, she sets up a table outside her house and there sells delicious vegetable empanadas, yucca mochines, corviches, and soft drinks. She works every day and has been doing this work for more than 5 years. She began her business with one of the loans that she got from the institution.

This loan is to purchase irons, blenders, and ingredients to make her snacks. She has been in this communal bank group from the beginning and she likes it for the help that it has given her to be able to begin her businesses. Her dream is to see her children succeed.

loans.use: to purchase irons and blenders, and ingredients to make her bite-sized foods.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras las emprendedoras, está en su tercer ciclo del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que quieren un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus familias.
Luz, miembro de este grupo, se dedica a las confecciones varias, ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y gracias al trabajo que tiene ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo viene abriéndose camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, lo que le ayudará en su trabajo y podrá ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras las emprendedoras' (Enterprising Women) committee is in its third cycle of the poverty eradication program. The women are heads of households who want a better future for themselves and their families. 

Luz, a member of this group, does various dressmaking activities. She is very good at what she does, and thanks to her job she helps her family and her loved ones and is able to give them everything that she didn't have. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman, who, with many sacrifices and much effort is making her way forward in life. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread, which will help her in her work and enable her to continue improving her quality of life and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Forty-three year old Elena raises and sells hogs. She is married with four children from Dulag, Leyte. Her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 4. 

She also engages in a food vending business. She cooks and sells home-made vegetable meals to the locals in her community.

Elena is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, and seasonings. These ingredients will be used in preparing a variety of meals.  In this way, she can now cater to larger customers and earn more. With this additional income, she can start to handle her finances and pay back her obligations. She will be able to provide a healthy diet and support the needs of her growing children.

Elena is hoping that she can handle her income properly for the improvement of her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat and seasonings.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 33 years old and a farmer who lives in a rural community. He is married but has no children yet. He plants and harvests various vegetables that he sells in their town. He aimed to improve his farming business in order to give his family a better life. He planned to plant more variety of vegetables but he has limited capital. For this reason, Joseph wants to obtain an additional of PHP 10,000 to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production. He hopes that this financial assistance will help him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leida Florentina

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Leída, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos  mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Leida junto al esposo  para salir adelante tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí venden todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas, artículos de bazar, papelería, gas de uso domestico lo cual les deja muy buenos ingresos ya que  son muy pocos los lugares donde se vende este producto muy útil en los hogares para la preparación de los alimentos,   trabajan todos el día desde la madrugada y muy entrada la noche. Tienen más de 8 años que se dedican a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, gas, aguas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The San Pedro De Pueblo communal bank meets every 15 days in the Pueblo Nuevo parish in the Santa Ana canton.  The people here are honest, and they devote themselves to working in the fields and working with livestock.  It has beautiful country landscapes and friendly people.

This is where Leida, age 57, lives.  She is married, and they have five adult children who are independent.  Her husband is a merchant.

Leida and her husband, in order to get ahead, have a store selling provisions.  They sell all types of products like rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, vegetables, fruit, household items, stationery goods, and gas for domestic use.  The business gives them very good earnings because there are very few places that sell these products.  The products are very useful to households in order to prepare food.  They work every day from dawn until very late at night.  They have been in the business, which gets them ahead, for over eight years.
