She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, gas, and water, among other basic needs products.

She has been a member of her communal bank since it started.  She likes it because the loans help them a lot.  Her goal is to continue expanding her business more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, gas, and water, among other basic needs products.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is aged 57 and married to a farmer. They are blessed with 1 child. Mila has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her daily net income is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds from her business, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase seedlings of eggplant, squash, and string beans to use in her vegetable production business. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of eggplant, squash, and string beans to use in her vegetable production business.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.fr: La cliente MWAVITA est veuve, mère de 8 enfants tous allant à l’école et présidente du groupe UPENDO.  Elle s’occupe de la vente des produits divers au marché grâce au premier fonds reçu de son défunt mari. Elle vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui servira d’acheter 3 cartons de super glue, 1 carton de cirage, 2 carton de pratico, 3 cartons de cahier et payer le transport. Son objectif pour l’avenir et qu’elle agrandisse son entreprise en devenant grossiste et paye les frais scolaires de se enfants. Elle remercie de tout cœur HEKIMA de son soutien.
texts.en: The client, MWAVITA, is a widow, mother of 8 children who all attend school and president of the group UPENDO.  She sells a range of products at the market thanks to the initial funds received from her late husband. She has just requested a loan which will allow her to buy 3 boxes of super glue, 1 box of polish, 2 boxes of pratico, 3 boxes of exercise books and pay for their transport.  Her aim for the future is to grow her business by becoming a wholesaler and to pay her children's school costs.  She thanks HEKIMA for their support with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of super glue, 1 box of polish, 2 boxes of pratico, 3 boxes of exercise books and pay for their transport

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Kratie province, Chantha is 36 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school and the other two are too young. To improve her family condition, she grows cassava on five hectares area and sells grocery items to earn extra income. For Chantha, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: A mother of four children living in Kampong Speu province, Oun is 43 years old. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family condition via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns her about $7.08 USD per day. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay a tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay a tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in accounting.

loans.name: Unite Group

texts.fr: Madame NTAKWINJA, veuve, âgée de 60 ans et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est membre du groupe UNITE où elle joue le rôle de présidente. Elle s’occupe de la vente des produits alimentaires suite au premier fonds venu de la poche de son mari depuis 1980. Elle vient demander un prêt qui lui permettra d’acquérir 50kg de farine de manioc et 50kg de haricot. Dans l’avenir, elle compte réfectionner sa maison et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. Ntakwinja is a 60 year old widow with four children, all of whom go to school. She is a member and acting president of the Unite group. She has been selling food products since 1980 when her husband gave her first funds. She requests a loan which will enable her to buy 50 kg of manioc flour and 50 kg of beans. In the future, she hopes to renovate her house and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of manioc flour and 50 kg of beans.

loans.name: Nhóm 3-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en: Lanh, 55, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 500,000. She is a single mom with an adopted child in 6th grade. She has been a member of local Women Union since 1997. Now, her family is in economic hardship and can not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will build a septic tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to environmental protection. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left. The man who is on the second row is a local resident.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Tuhimizane Group

texts.fr: Madame KASINAMUNTU est cliente du groupe TUHIMIZANE , où elle occupe le poste de vice-présidente.Elle est mariée à un infirmier, mère de 5 enfants à l’âge de 40ans. Elle s’occupe de la vente des médicaments dans sa pharmacie, activité entreprise depuis 2000 suite au premier soutien de son mari. Elle vient solliciter un pret pour acheter 25 boites de paracétamol, 30 boites d’Amoxycilline, 7 Amoxycilline sirop, 1 douzaine de sérum ringer et 3 boites d’ampicilline dans le but de d’agrandir son entreprise et de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants dans les jours à venir. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien indéfectible qu’elle apporte aux femmes à faibles revenus.
texts.en: Mrs. Kasinamuntu is a member and vice-president of the Tuhimizane group. She is married to a nurse, and is 40 years old with five children. She sells medication in her pharmacy. She started this business in 2000 with her husband's support. She requests a loan to buy 25 boxes of Paracetamol, 30 boxes of Amoxicillin, seven bottles of Amoxicillin syrup, one dozen bottles of Ringer's solution, and 30 boxes of Ampicillin. These purchases will enable her to expand her business and pay for her children's school fees in the coming days. She thanks Hekima for the unfailing support that they provide for women with small incomes.

loans.use: to buy 25 boxes of Paracetamol, 30 boxes of Amoxicillin, seven bottles of Amoxicillin syrup, one dozen bottles of Ringer's solution, and 30 boxes of Ampicillin.

loans.name: Thath

texts.en:
Thath is 27 years old and married with a child in her care. She lives in Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2002. Her husband is a 24-year-old factory worker. Thath and her husband can earn about $13 each day. 

She has decided to get a loan to buy cement, bricks and concrete sewers to build a bathroom with a toilet. With the bathroom and a toilet, Thath and her family will be able to have hygienic living conditions. For her future plans, she is going to buy piglets to fatten, save money to renovate her house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and concrete sewers to build a bathroom with a toilet

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is selling silver and gold jewelry. Her husband is the one who makes different styles and designs of rings, earrings, bracelets and necklaces.
 
Angelina is proud to share that her jewelries are unique and made by her husband. Angelina also accepts made-to-order jewelry requests in order to satisfy her customers’ wants. Her goal is to make her customers satisfied with their orders in order to become her regular customers. 

In this connection, Angelina is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy materials needed in making jewelry. She believes that by availing herself of the loan, she will fix and deliver her customers' orders on time. Angelina will do her best to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in making jewelry.

loans.name: Nurdin

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Nurdin, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Depok. Depok is a city located at the south of Jakarta. 

Nurdin is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with three children. Nurdin owns and manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payments service to his community. Nurdin joined Ruma about 9 months ago because he wanted to improve his small stall. 

As the business runs, Nurdin is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. 

In the photo, Nurdin is standing in his small stall where he usually serves many transactions from the customers who are mostly his neighbors. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Lycee Kazaroho Group

texts.fr: Monsieur BARHAME, président du groupe LYCEE KAZAROHO, âgée de 39 ans est père  de 4 enfants tous écoliers. Il est enseignant et mariée à une femme ménagère. Il vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui permettra de réhabiliter sa maison. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour avoir songé à un produit qui aidera les enseignants à modiques rémunérations.
texts.en: Mr. Barhame is the president of the Lycee Kazaroho group. He is 39 years old with four children who all go to school. He is a teacher and married to a housekeeper. He requests a loan which will enable him to renovate his house. He thanks Hekima for having thought of a product that will help teachers with modest salaries.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Dieng

texts.en:
Dieng is twenty-five years old and lives in a small community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is married to Sokna, who is twenty-seven years old. They do not have a child yet. To make a living and support his family, Dieng  manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers. He has been involved in this type of business for almost ten years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day.

Dieng's earnings from farming are very low. He wants to have one more business so that he can have a supplementary income. However, his limited capital doesn't allow him to do so. That is why he is applying for a Kiva loan, so he can have capital to invest in a jar-selling business. This loan will allow him to have one more source of income and help to remove poverty from his life. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to invest in a jar-selling business

loans.name: Virgen De Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de la Asuncion se formo en la ciudad de Lambaré, son 18 mujeres que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias, cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Laura, integrante de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de comidas, que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora que poco a poco se abrió camino y hoy día ya tiene muy buena clientela formada que siempre compra de ella sus productos.
Pide este préstamo, ya que con el podrá comprar insumos varios para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser: verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, hortalizas, panificados y demás. Ellas agradecen por la ayuda que reciben para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, Virgen de la Asunción, was formed in the city of Lambaré by 18 women who joined together to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Each woman is putting forth her best effort in order to grow and get ahead.

Laura, a member of this group, sells food that she makes herself, then goes out to sell on foot later. She is a very selfless person with a fighting spirit, who gradually made her way, and now she has made very good customers who always buy her products.

She is requesting this loan to buy various supplies so that she can make her food, such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, leafy vegetables, baked goods, and others.

The women appreciate the help that they are receiving, that enables them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, green vegetables, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is aged 46 and married to an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They are blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 1,200 weekly. Her weekly net income was usually spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 59 years old and married with five children.

Nemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Nemia has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing and a frozen foods business.

Nemia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is fifty-three years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for thirty-two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.fr: Maman BARHALIBIRIRA, âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants tous écoliers, est cliente du groupe MWANGAZA où elle assume les responsabilités de présidente. Elle est vendeuse des souliers  et pagnes grâce au fonds de roulement obtenu de son mari depuis 2000. Elle vient de sollicter un crédit qui lui permettra d’acquérir 10 douzaines de souliers et 20 pagnes. Le fruit de cette activité sera utilisé dans la construction de la maison, le payement des frais scolaires des enfants et dans l’épargne. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout coeur.
texts.en: Mother Barhalibirira is 48 years old and married with 10 children who all go to school. She is a member and president of the Mwangaza group. She has been selling shoes and traditional pagne dresses since 2000 thanks to working capital that her husband gave her. She requests a loan which will enable her to buy 10 dozen pairs of shoes and 20 pagnes. She will use the fruit of this activity to build a house, to pay school fees for the children, and to save. She thanks Hekima with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen pairs of shoes and 20 pagnes.

loans.name: Bukengere Group

texts.fr: La cliente BILILO, vendeuse des produits  divers au marché  central depuis plus de 8 ans grâce au soutien de son mari, est âgée de 49 ans, mère de 8 enfants dont 3 n’étudient pas et présidente du groupe BUKENGERE. Elle vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui permettra de se procurer 2 douzaines de singlet, 5 douzaines de sous vêtement dames, 5 douzaines de sous vêtement hommes et 15 chaussettes.Son but est d’agrandir son entreprise, payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et renforcer son système d’épargne. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour avoir favorisé l’accès facile des femmes aux crédits.
texts.en: The client named Bililo has been selling various products at the central market for over eight years, with to her husband's support. She is 49 years old with eight children of whom only three do not go to school. She is the president of the Bukengere group. She requests a loan which will enable her to buy two dozen vests, five dozen units of ladies underwear, five dozen units of men's underwear, and 15 pairs of socks. Her goal is to expand her business, pay the school fees for her children, and solidify her savings. She thanks Hekima for facilitating access to credits for women.

loans.use: to buy two dozen vests, five dozen units of ladies underwear, five dozen units of men's underwear, and 15 pairs of socks.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras,  están en el quinto ciclo con 18 integrantes, estas mujeres se han propuesto metas en la vida que lograran a través del trabajo cooperativo y solidario.
Entre ellas se destaca la señora Mabel por su laboriosidad, trabaja de manera independiente, tiene una huerta en su casa, ahí cultiva toda clase de hortalizas, que una vez listas las vende por zonas aledañas a su casa. Es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere seguir creciendo y trabajando.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de abonos, semillas y demás productos para poder seguir con el cultivo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo
texts.en:
The village bank is called Mujeres Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women], they are in their fifth cycle with 18 members. These women have proposed life goals that they will achieve through cooperative work and solidarity.

Among them Mabel stands out for her laboriousness and independent working manner. She has a garden in her house, there she grows all types of vegetables. Once they are ready, she sells them in the areas surrounding her house. She is a very hardworking and sacrificing person who wants to continue growing and working.

She is applying for this loan for the purchase of fertilizers, seeds and more products to be able to continue with the crops and, in this manner, continue helping her family like she's doing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and more products.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Union está en su  ciclo 4 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes, la Sra. Rafaela, mostro en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que está en un novel de pobreza extrema, pero ella se sigue esforzando para poder superarla. Ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, y por medio de este negocio lucha por poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, panificados y demás, con lo cual podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda, para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called Unión is in its fourth cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank Program.  They are completing the Elimination of Poverty Survey, where 4 of the 17 women find themselves below the poverty line—that is, in extreme poverty.

One of the members, Señora Rafaela, indicated in her Elimination of Poverty Survey that her level of poverty is extreme, but she continues striving to be able to overcome it.  She has a grocery store in which she works every day, starting very early; and it is by means of this business that she fights to be able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in purchasing supplies for her store, such as vegetables, meat, fruit, baked goods, and others, with which she will be able to offer her customers a good variety of products for sale. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, which will help her very much to be able to keep improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, fruit, baked goods and such, in order to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak is a 21-year-old freshman at university majoring in hotel and tourism. He lives in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. 

Heak is also working at the moment as a waiter in a hotel, making approximately $6 a day. His father is a construction worker and his mother is a grocer. 

Heak is short of finances to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year, so he has decided to apply for a loan. This loan will help him to graduate. 

Regarding his dreams after graduation, he wants to have a better job with a good salary, and to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.es:
La sra. Esmelda es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casada, y también tiene hijos, ella tiene una despensa con carnicería, y comenta que su marido se dedica a la compra y ventas de animales vacunos. Son una pareja muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se están esforzando por sus hijos, para poder darles todo lo que no pudo tener.
Esmelda es una señora muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, que empezó con un pequeño copetín, pero que después poco  a poco ha ido creciendo con su trabajo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, bebidas, lácteos y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Esmelda is from the city of Santaní, she is married and also has children. She has a grocery store with butcher shop, and notes that her husband works buy and selling bovines. They are a very hardworking and tenacious couple, who are pushing themselves for their children, to be able to give them all that they couldn't have.

Esmelda is a very hardworking, responsible and very honest woman. She started with a small food counter but later, little buy little, she has gone growing with her work.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies for her grocery store, like vegetables, fruits, meet, drinks, dairy products and more. In this manner, she will be able to continue with her work like she's doing. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meet, drinks, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Rohila

texts.en:
Rohila is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1973. She lives in a village. She is married. She has one child. Her husband is a cook. 

Rohila is a participant on the course “To Get Ahead”. She had a dream to have a sewing business. After training she decided to open a new business. She wants to open a “Sewing workshop”. 

For the realization of her dream she needs start-up capital. She is asking for financial support to buy a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, 58, is married with five adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 23 years already. 

The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and secured their own jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed herself previously of loans to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a 48-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been growing rice in her field for more than five years now. Farming is her source of income. 

Glenda is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Glenda hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Areida Celeste

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Areida, tiene 64 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes, hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Areida es una mujer muy luchadora que  para salir adelante sola hace mas de 32 años puso en su casa un  taller de costura, allí ella confecciona todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta confeccionar es la ropa de damas y niños, ella también tiene un pequeño local en su casa en la cual en las mañanas vende leche y queso, ella compra la leche y el queso a ganaderos de la zona para luego distribuirlo al menudeo o al por mayor a comerciantes que llevan a otras partes a vender estos productos. Es así como ella sale  adelante sin depender de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar leche, queso y materiales de costura.  Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The San Pedro de Pueblo credit group meets every fifteen days in the Pueblo Nuevo parish, Santa Ana canton, a place of honest people who are dedicated to labor of the country and cattle raising, with beautiful country landscapes and friendly people.

Areida lives in this place, she is 64. Several years ago her husband passed away but from this relationship she had five children, of age and independent. Several years ago she learned cutting and sewing in an academy in the area.

Areida is a very tenacious woman who, to get ahead, more than 32 years ago, put a sewing shop in her home alone. There she sewed all types of clothing for women, men and children. Although she knows that what she most likes to sew is clothing for women and children, she also has a small place in her house in which in the mornings she sells milk and cheese. She buys the milk and cheese from the cattle raisers of the area to later distribute it as retail or as wholesale to merchants to take it to other places to sell these products. This is how she gets ahead without depending on her children.

This loan is to buy milk, cheese and sewing materials. She has been in the credit group since it started and she likes it because of the help that the loans bring. Her dreams are to continue ahead and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese, and sewing materials.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, 54, is a small-holder farmer who resides in the Eldoret area of Kenya. The mother of three has been a farmer for four years. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk and a side business (posho mill). 

Anna finds farming to be very enjoyable. However, as she is aging, she is finding dairy farming to be challenging. She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business since the demand for poultry products is always high. 

With your loan, Anna is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Anna is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Enyanya Group

texts.fr: La cliente KABAMBA est présidente du groupe ENYANYA à l’âge de 50 ans. Mariée et mère de 8 enfants tous écoliers, elle s’occupe de la vente des produits pétroliers depuis 1998 suite au premier fonds de roulement obtenu de son mari. Elle vient de solliciter un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 5 bidons d’essence. Son rêve est d’agrandir son entreprise, payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et renforcer sa capacité d’épargner. C’est pourquoi, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son grand soutien.
texts.en: The client, Kabamba is the president of the group ENYANYA and is 50 years old.  She is married and mother of 8 children who are all in school.  She has sold petroleum products since 1998 having received start up working capital from her husband.  She has asked for a loan to allow her to buy 5 canisters of petrol.  Her dream is to grow her business, pay her children's school expenses and increase her capacity to save.  This is why she thanks HEKIMA for their great support.

loans.use: to buy 5 canisters of petrol

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is forty-seven years old and married with nine children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Margie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to in order buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Margie has been in this business for twenty-six years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is fifty-two years old and widowed woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mila has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Mila has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Mila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is forty-five years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lolita has been in this business for twenty-two years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Nyushulira Group

texts.fr: Maman MUSELEMU, âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants tous écoliers, est cliente du groupe NYUSHULIRA où elle assume les responsabilités de présidente. Elle est vendeuse des savons  grâce au fonds de roulement obtenu de son frère. Elle vient de solliciter un crédit qui lui permettra d’acquérir 10 cartons de savon. Le revenu de cette activité sera utilisé dans l’agrandissement de son entreprise, le payement des frais scolaires des enfants et dans l’épargne.Au final, la cliente remercie HEKIMA de lutter contre la pauvreté au travers les femmes.
texts.en: Muselemu, aged 48 is married and mother of 7 children who are all in school.  She is a client of the group Nyushulira, where she has taken on the responsibilities of president.  She sells soap, thanks to the working capital received from her brother.  She is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy 10 boxes of soap.  The income from this activity will be used to grow her business, to pay the school costs for her children and to save.  Finally, the client thanks Hekima for fighting against poverty through women.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of soap

loans.name: Tuwe Hodari Group

texts.fr: La cliente ZAWADI est présidente du groupe TUWE HODARI.Elle est vendeuse des fretins au marché central de la ville grâce au fonds de démarrage reçu de son mari à l’âge de 35 ans. Mère de 6 enfants tous allant à l’école, elle  vient de solliciter un prêt  qui lui  permettra d’acheter  ½  sac de fretins et payer le transport. Elle compte agrandir son entreprise dans les jours à venir et renforcer son système d’épargne. A cet effet, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: Zawadi is president of the group Tuwe Hodari.  She sells small fry fish in the town's central market thanks to the start up funds received from her husband when she was 35.  She is mother of 6 children who all go to school.  She has requested a loan which will allow her to buy half a sack of small fry fish and pay for the transport.  She plans to grow her business in the future and strengthen her savings method.  It is because of this she thanks Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to buy half a sack of small fry fish and pay for the transport

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Ilham, a Ruma agent who lives in Depok. Depok is a city located at the south of Jakarta. Ilham is happily married, and his wife is a kindergarten teacher. As a main source of income, Ilham owns and manages a small stall that mobile phone sim cards, mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payments service to his community. Ilham joined Ruma about a year ago because he wanted to improve his business and he felt excited to learn more about mobile technology from the Ruma mobile application. 

As his business continues, Ilham is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Ilham also plans to improve his sales in a new product from Ruma, which is an e-commerce application for remote communities called 'Mapan'. By serving Mapan to his customers, Ilham will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Ilham will simply send an SMS to an SMS center; the customer will pay him, and a Ruma agent will come to his stall to collect the money. Within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door. With Mapan, Ilham believes that his community will have access to good quality products with better prices. Of course, his stall will be also improve. In the photo, Ilham is sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends

loans.name: Mapenzi Group

texts.fr: Madame FATUMA, âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants est membre du groupe MAPENZI où elle est présidente. Elle s’occupe de la vente des souliers au marché depuis 2005. Elle vient de rdemander un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 30 paires de souliers. Les revenus de son activité l’aideront à agrandir son entreprise, se faire construire une maison et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour ses produits qui aident les femmes à faibles revenus de recevoir  de crédit à moindre coût et en toute facilité.
texts.en: Fatuma, aged 38, married and mother of 4 children is a member of the group Mapenzi, of which she is president.  The has been selling shoes in the market since 2005.  She has requested a loan which will allow her to buy 30 pairs of shoes.  The income from her activity will help her to grow her business, build a house and pay her children's school costs.  She thanks Hekima for their products which help women with low income to readily get low cost credit.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama, age 35, is a mother of three sons and two daughters. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his wife Shama is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and raw materials of embroidery. 

Shama is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and raw materials for her husband's embroidery shop

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 30 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of five people.

Samina is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to the people at her own house. She needs to a purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her stitching work, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan which issued her loan as per her requirement. Samina is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine along with zippers, buttons and threads for tailoring at home.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a fifty-one-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Lahore, Pakistan with her spouse and seven children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years. He alone is responsible for meeting the financial needs of the entire family. Khursheed's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories). But due to some financial constraints, he is not able to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Khursheed has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy tailoring accessories to fulfil his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income. For this financial assistance Khursheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery for her daughter.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“There are many reasons why I am applying for a Kiva loan. First of all, it is because of my family’s financial situation. There are nine members of my family: my grandparents, my parents, my two elder siblings, two younger siblings and me. We are a big and lucky family, because there are three generations in it! My parents work a lot to support our big family. My grandparents are pensioners, and my grandmother is a disabled person of the second group, who often needs special treatment in a hospital and sanatorium. We love our grandparents - they are the story-tellers, who don’t make us worried or upset but instead tell stories about the older generations and give advice on how to act in difficult times. Thanks to them we know the love of old people and what it is to be an old person.

The second reason for this loan is because I believe that AUCA will play the role of a ladder for me, which will enable me to climb up towards the peak of my aims. Not only is AUCA one of the top universities in the region, it is an educational bridge between east and west. With the knowledge and a degree from AUCA, one can easily compete in the job market, as well as pursue graduate studies in the west. My advice to AUCA students who would like to pursue graduate studies - take full advantage of the facilities and opportunities there. Also, for those who want to do an MBA, economics or finance programs - work hard on your math skills so you can score high on the GMAT or GRE tests.

I am full of plans for the next four years and will do my best to realize them.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Nhóm 9-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thoi is fifty-seven and works as a farmer with monthly income of about VND 550,000. She lives with her two sons who are attending vocational school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1996. Currently, her household does not have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, Thoi will use the fund to build a septic tank toilet. This will improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. In this photo, she is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
After a six-month loan period, Kadek and the Sumbersari Permai Group paid back the loan without any problems. From the sales of piglets, Kadek earned a profit of 250.000 IDR per month. This result is far from the previous expectation where Kadek hoped to earn 400.000 IDR per month. High feed prices and the death of some of her pigs death due to disease are the main factors that caused a drop in profits. This loss in earningd did not dampen Kadek's spirit to operate her business. She along with other members of the group requested another loan to shore up their businesses.

As a housewife who lives in the village, Kadek raises the pigs in order to help her husband to fulfill her family needs. She requested a loan from MUK with her group for 1,500.000 IDR, which she will use to buy piglets and feed. Kadek expects the per kilo price of pigs to rise and feed prices to decline in the next six months so that the benefits will be more than the previous period. She hopes the future of her business improves so as to assist her in improving the welfare of her family.

Kadek is in  front line on the left, wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, Lucena requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of swine production, she is considering adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is the age of 29, and she is a mother of four children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a cigarette and pan shop for many years near their house and the business is operating very well. Following customer demand, he wants to offer juices, soft drinks, cold drinks, etc. He does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable during one's daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. 

Therefore Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy cigarettes, pans, juices, soft drinks, cold drinks, etc. for his shop. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her husband will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. 

Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's pan shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Residing in Rattanakiri province, Yen is forty-seven years old and a mother of six children. She struggles to support her family by selling grocery items and engaging in rice cropping to earn additional income. This is Yen's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion on tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree majoring in Management. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Management.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chey Sen District

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia is thirty-eight and lives in Lahore with her husband and six children. Her son has been running a barber shop for many years and used the same salon equipment for many years. As a result, he has worn out the equipment and needs to buy replacements. He wants to buy new revolving chairs and plastic furniture for his salon but his financial condition does not allow him to do this. Due to his low purchasing power, Razia requested a loan so that her son can easily buy new revolving chairs and plastic furniture for his salon. Razia hopes that this loan will work positively and she will be able to make some savings to spend on household expenses. Razia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new revolving chairs and plastic furniture for her son's barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en:
Aibek is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is his story:

“I am requesting a Kiva loan to pay for my university tuition because my family can’t afford it. I really want to study at AUCA as I believe that I can get the best education and experience here. I want to be successful as all alumni of this university. Despite the financial difficulty in my family, I hope to realize my goals thanks to Kiva lenders.

My parents divorced when I was 2 months old and I live with my mother. She used to work and support us as best she could, until she underwent two operations in 2013. She stopped working for several months, but then was forced to do something in order to live and eat. Thanks to my uncle we survived and I could finish school. But my uncle has his own family and he can’t always help us. He bought me a bike several years ago, so I was able to save money on transportation and go to school or elsewhere by bike. But now it is winter and I can’t walk 3 miles to the university and back, so I need money also for transportation.

Thanks to my mother’s patience, my sister could get a good education and get married. My mother’s present dream is to give me a good education. As we live together with my mother, we have dinner together, and we visit our relatives. They are very interested in my academic achievements, and we think that an education is the most powerful weapon to combat poverty, unemployment and social inequality, and it is the key for a balanced, bright and stable future. 

I am very fortunate to have this opportunity to mobilize some resources through Kiva, and I greatly appreciate lenders’ trust in me and their help.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Good Hope School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Alex. He is the Head teacher of Good Hope Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nabulagala in Kampala with 30 students. Good Hope Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The schools do not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Good Hope Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Alex ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Queens Way School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fadalah. He is the Head Teacher of Queens Way College, a mixed school in the Rural area of Lugazi in Buikwe with 187 students. Queens Way College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Queens Way College will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fadalah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kitemu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the Head teacher of Kitemu Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Nsangi in Wakiso with 280 students. Kitemu Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kitemu Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mukono College School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kefa. He is the Head teacher of Mukono College of Science and Technology, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Mukono with __ students. Mukono College of Science and Technology has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mukono College of Science and Technology will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kefa ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sanyu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Martin. He is the Head Teacher of Sanyu Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kiwatule in Kampala with 400 students. Sanyu Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sanyu Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Martin ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Roque” forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas están mejorando sus condiciones de vida, gracias al esfuerzo que hace, con lo cual irán mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Mariana, una de las integrantes de este grupo, comenta que vende cosméticos varios, es una persona muy trabajadora, que poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio se ha abierto camino, y con este trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Mariana sueña con poder seguir con su trabajo para poder ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Pide este préstamo, ya que con el podrá comprar cosméticos más variados, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y emprendedora.
texts.en:
The “San Roque” Group is part of the Elimination of Poverty Program, in which the women are improving their living conditions; and thanks to their efforts, they will continue to improve them.

Mariana, one of the members of this group, sells various cosmetics.  She is a hard-working person who gradually and with much sacrifice, has made progress; and with this work she helps her family and loved ones.  Mariana dreams of being able to continue with her work in order to be able to overcome her situation of poverty.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase a greater variety of cosmetics, and thus be able to continue with her sales. She is a very selfless and enterprising woman.

loans.use: to purchase various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en:
Gulruhsor is a kind woman who is married with three children. She was born in 1969 and lives in a village. For the past ten years, Gulruhsor has been a farmer who plants potatoes and onions. In the past she worked at collective farm, but after partition she has personal land. Gulruhsor uses her profits to feed her family.

Gulruhsor is requesting a loan to buy a ticket to see her son.

loans.use: to buy a ticket to see her son

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.en:
Ranogul is a cheerful woman who is married with four children. She is from the southern part of Tajikistan and lives in rural area. Ranogul is a tailor who works from home where she takes orders from clients. She does good work and her clients are all satisfied. Ranogul’s husband is a laborer and she keeps the family by herself. 

Ranogul is requesting a loan to renovate her house as it is in bad condition. She will use her loan to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for her work

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day. 

Natividad is requesting a loan to pay for spare motor parts and to cover repair costs. Her loan will allow her to continue her business. In the future, Natividad dreams of owning more motor vehicles and being able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for spare motor parts and repair

loans.name: Nedita

texts.en:
Nedita has a small beauty salon where she earns a living offering manicures, pedicures, and many other beauty services. Nedita is 44 years old, married, and lives in Catagan in Tangub City. 

Nedita is now well-known for the good quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new equipment for her hair and spa services and has been able to save revenue earned from them. Her services are self-sustainable and have become profitable, with a net profit of about 6,000 PHP per month. 

Nedita wants to live a decent and comfortable life, and she has applied for a loan to purchase hollow cement blocks and bags of cement for her house renovation. This is a regular loan and would be repaid in few months. 

In Nedita's 5 previous loans she has never had a delinquency. She is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase hollow cement blocks and bags of cement for her house renovation.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 41 years old, has 5 children, and lives in Sidika village in Ndhiwa sub county Kenya. Alice works as a subsistence farmer for a living. Her community does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Alice is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Alice represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Alice and 2 other promoters in her community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Alice wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will make the water safe for drinking, thus alleviating water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Alice’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Haneefan

texts.en:
Haneefan is 47 years old and married with four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Haneefan’s husband owns a business where he sells clothing. This is the only source of income for the family. Presently, her husband needs additional capital to grow his business. 

Haneefan is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothing to sell. Her loan will help him respond quickly to customer needs and she hopes that her loan will help her husband’s business. Haneefan’s husband will use the profit from his loan to save to pay their electricity and gas bill. Haneefan is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her husband's business

loans.name: Quinter's Group

texts.en:
Quinter is 28 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Wachara C village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Wachara C village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Hope church borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Quinter and her family, as well as other members of the community, may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Quinter works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water in order to stay healthy. Quinter and Joyce, another promoter in her community, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Quinter will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and she will refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Quinter wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will alleviate water-borne diseases by killing germs.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Quinter’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson lives in a home within Kawigawiga village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya with his family which includes 4 children. The community of Kawigawiga village collects their drinking water from Aora Odundu because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kawigawiga’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Kawigawiga, 25 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser.  Samson has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 4 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan:namely Siprose, Grace, Susan, and Maurice.

Kawigawiga village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Samson believes that the dispenser will help to alleviate water-borne diseases in his community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Samson’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old, has 5 children, and lives in Kachar village in Ndhiwa sub county Kenya. Teresa works as a subsistence farmer for a living. Where Teresa lives, her family and her community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from Kang'iela well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If the community had a way to treat their water, they could improve the health of their community, keeping children at school and parents at work.

This is why Teresa is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of her community. Teresa was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people in Kachar village on the importance of safe water, and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Teresa wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine helps reduce water-borne diseases in the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Teresa’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.name: Vivian's Group

texts.en:
In Wanjawa A village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Vivian has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Vivian is a friendly member of the community with 2 children. Vivian lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and iron roof.

Wanjawa A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Ka-Charles well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Vivian’s family and the 19 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area.

Vivian has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Vivian volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community have better health, so that children do not miss school and community members can continue to work hard. There are also several other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: namely Helen, Fredrick, Selermina and Mary.

Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Vivian’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

Kenny ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Canon High & Lugazi Community Schools

texts.en:

He is the Chairperson of Canon High School and Lugazi Community Primary Day and Boarding School, mixed schools in the Rural area of Lugazi in Buikwe with 1950 students. Canon High and Lugazi Community Primary Day and Boarding Schools have requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for their students. The schools do not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore have to spend a considerable portion of their budgets on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the schools money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the schools to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Canon High and Lugazi Community Primary Day and Boarding Schools will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Bernard ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the schools.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine lives in a home with mud walls, dirt floor, and a grass roof in Bogesia B village in Kuria East Sub-county, Kenya with her family which includes 3 children. The community of Bogesia B village collects their drinking water from a local well because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Bogesia B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser program offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. Bogesia B community will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Catherine has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water in order to keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 3 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Susan, Joseph and Margret. 

Bogesia B community needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Catherine believes that using the chlorine dispenser will reduce the number of reported cases of water-borne diseases, thus enabling the community to be healthy and active. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Catherine’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers
