loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1980. She is a widow. She has four children. For about twelve years, she has had a business. She cooks cakes and pancakes. She takes orders at home. Mukaddas alone feeds her family.

 Long ago she planned to buy furniture for her household. She has not enough money for buying furniture for the household. She is asking for financial support for buying furniture for the household. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres luchadoras está en su noveno ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas luchan por sus hijos, para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Marilina integra este grupo, ella se destaca por el entusiasmo que tiene, además siempre da todo de sí en cada actividad que hace. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que con trabajo ha logrado todo lo que tiene. Ella se dedica a la peluquería, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio y es muy bien atendidos por ella.
Marilina pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su salón de belleza, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, y así seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called "Combative Women is in its ninth loan cycle in the program sponsored by the Women's Committee. Additionally, they form part of the program to eliminate poverty where each and every one of them struggles for their children, to be able to offer them a better quality of life.

Marilina belongs to this group. She is known for her enthusiasm and she always gives her all in every activity she begins. She is a very sacrificing woman who has gained all she has through hard work. Marilina dedicates herself to her beauty parlor. She has a good group of customers who always come to her business and are well attended to.

Marilina is requesting this loan to be able to purchase inputs for her salon, including hair coloring, creams, shampoo, hair rinses, and other supplies so that she can continue offering her good services to her customers and thus, continue struggling to improve the family's conditions of life.

loans.use: buy hair coloring, creams, shampoo, hair rinses, and other beauty parlor supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña Guapa forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ella son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 
Alicia es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora, que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para ser ejemplo para sus compañeras. Ella es modista, hace todo tipo de prendas y también compostura, es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que siempre tiene muy buena clientela.
Alicia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, como lo viene haciendo, y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: The group, called Kuña Guapa, is part of a program to eliminate poverty.  They are woman, in charge of their families, who fight to better the conditions of their lives and those of their families.  Alicia is the president of the group and is a very hard-working woman who is always trying to give the best of herself so that she can be a good examples for her colleagues.  She is a seamstress; she makes all different types of outfits and repairs.  She is very good at what she does, it is for this reasons that she has such a good clientele.  Alicia is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in buying fabrics, thread, buttons and more things so that she can keep working, as she has been and also better the conditions of hers and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons and more to produce

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita makes good earnings on her rice farming activities in Plaridel, Philippines. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially since she has a high cost of living since her children entered college. 

Rosita approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and bags of fertilizer for more produce. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this crop season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and bags of fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is from Aquino, Tangub in the Philippines. Her husband is a farmer and the income he gets is not enough to cover the needs of the family. In order to help,  Emelyn has engaged in snack vending business. To generate more income, Emelyn decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can get financial assistance from PMPC.

 As Emelyn has saved an amount from her business, she thought of doing farming activities to earn additional income. Consequently, she requested a loan to pay for the acquisition of a pawned parcel of agricultural land to start her farming project. Emelyn smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of a pawned parcel of agricultural land to start her farming project

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a large-scale business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is from Unidos, Plaridel in the Philippines. He is 42 years of age. He and his partner have 4 school-age kids. In July of 2012, he joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. From his desire to sufficiently provide for his family, he has engaged in buying and selling assorted bread in different barangays (neighborhoods) in the municipality of Plaridel. Only his motorcycle is used as his source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell bread. 

Ruel's source of income has existed for two years now. In need of additional working capital, he requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase more assorted bread to sell. In this way, he hopes to increase his sales and have more income so he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family. He is also happy that he can support the education of his children which is his main priority of his hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted bread to sell

loans.name: Nasri

texts.en:
Nasri is a hardworking woman. She is a wise woman. She lives in small town. She is married. She has three children. She has had a business for about seven years. She is a seller. She sells dry fruits like pistachios, raisins, almonds, apricots and different types of nuts. 

Her start up income was 500 somoni. For several years she obtained positive results. Her personal capital is more than 8,000 somoni now. She wants to enlarge her business. She is planning to buy additional products to sell. For the future she is planning to resell her goods adding an additional price to them. Now Nasri is asking for financial support to increase her business activity.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to increase her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras se llama este grupo, esta en su ciclo numero 4 del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres jefas de familia, que quieren ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos. 
La  Sra. Selva, se dedica a la venta de verduras en general y también a la venta de ropas, es una persona que pese a las adversidades esta trabajando duro para poder salir adelante e ir superando su situación de pobreza. Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que poco a poco quiere ir mejorando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Selva solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus verduras y frutas tales como: naranjas, banabas, peras, manzanas, etc., short, remeras, vaqueros, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Trabajadoras.  It is in its fourth cycle with the elimination of poverty program.  They are women who are the heads of their families.  They want to be improving their living conditions and those of their children.

Selva sells general vegetables.  She also sells clothes.  She is a person who, in spite of the adversities, is working hard in order to be able to get ahead and overcome her poverty situation.  She is a very tenacious person who, little by little, wants to be improving in order to be able to continue helping her family.

Selva is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and fruits like oranges, bananas, pears, and apples, etc.  She will also buy shorts, t-shirts, and jeans, etc.  This will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits like oranges, bananas, pears, and apples, shorts, t-shirts, and jeans, etc

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers come in daily. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy restaurant utensils and renovate the business premises. Her business goal is to be able to offer outside catering services within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family's financial needs. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy restaurant utensils and renovate the business premises.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gideon Jr.

texts.en:
Gideon Jr. owns and manages a shop that sells motor and bicycle spare parts and accessories in Labuyo, Tangub in the Philippines. Being a regular and active member of PMPC, he diligently pays all his obligations from the earnings of his shop. 

Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase additional stock of motor and bicycle spare parts and accessories. He is adding an extension shop in a nearby barangay (village), and he wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of motor and bicycle spare parts and accessories
